original: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /🔽sam bandha pa r'i ksha t'i k'a /
analyzed: @1b # // rgya gar skad du / sam bandha pa r'i ksha t'i k'a /
translated: In Sanskrit:🔽Sambandhaparīkṣātīkā

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'brel ba brtag pa'i rgya cher bshad pa /
analyzed: 'brel ba brtag pa'i rgya cher bshad pa /
translated: Extensive explanation of the investigation of relation

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to youthful Mañjuśrī.🔽The teacher of the world has said

original: 'gro ba thams cad 'brel med par //🔽'gro ba'i bla ma gang gsungs pa //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad 'brel med par // 'gro ba'i bla ma gang gsungs pa //
translated: that all beings are unrelated.

original: de la rab tu phyag 'tshal nas //
analyzed: de la rab tu phyag 'tshal nas //
translated: Having paid homage to him,

original: 'brel ba brtag pa bshad par bya //
analyzed: 'brel ba brtag pa bshad par bya //
translated: I will explain the investigation of relation.

original: 'brel ba dngos por gyur pa bsal bar 'dod nas zhes bya ba'i tshig dang po 'dis rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'brel ba dang / brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa rnams ston to //
analyzed: 'brel ba dngos por gyur pa bsal bar 'dod nas zhes bya ba'i tshig dang po 'dis rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'brel ba dang / brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa rnams ston to //
translated: The first phrase, “wishing to refute the reality of relation,” teaches the relation, the subject matter, and the purpose of this chapter.

original: gzhan du na 'brel ba dang / brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa rnams dang bral ba'i rab tu byed pa ni blang bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na 'brel ba dang / brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa rnams dang bral ba'i rab tu byed pa ni blang bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, a chapter devoid of relation, subject matter, and purpose would not be worth taking up.

original: de la 'brel pa dngos por gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni brjod par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: de la 'brel pa dngos por gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni brjod par bya ba bstan to //
translated: The phrase “the reality of relation” teaches the subject matter.

original: bsal bar 'dod nas zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni dgos pa bstan te /
analyzed: bsal bar 'dod nas zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni dgos pa bstan te /
translated: The words “in order to eliminate” indicate the purpose.

original: 'di ltar 'brel pa dngos por gyur pa bsal ba ni 'dir dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'brel pa dngos por gyur pa bsal ba ni 'dir dgos pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the elimination of a real relation is the purpose here.

original: smras so zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'brel ba smos te /
analyzed: smras so zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'brel ba smos te /
translated: The words “said” indicate the relation.

original: 'di ltar 'brel ba dngos por gyur pa bsal ba'i phyir rab tu @2a * //🔽byed pa 'di bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'brel ba dngos por gyur pa bsal ba'i phyir rab tu @2a * // byed pa 'di bstan to //
translated: Thus, in order to eliminate a real relation, this treatise is presented.

original: de lta bas na 'brel ba dngos por gyur pa bsal ba la rab tu byed pa ni thabs kho nar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'brel ba dngos por gyur pa bsal ba la rab tu byed pa ni thabs kho nar bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the treatise is taught as the mere means for eliminating a real relation.

original: 'di ltar rab tu byed pa 'di thos bas 'brel pa dngos por gyur pa med do zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rab tu byed pa 'di thos bas 'brel pa dngos por gyur pa med do zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by hearing this treatise, one will ascertain that there is no real relation.

original: de nas rab tu byed pa ni thabs yin no //
analyzed: de nas rab tu byed pa ni thabs yin no //
translated: Then, the treatise is the means.

original: 'brel ba dngos por gyur pa bsal ba ni thabs las byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'brel ba dngos por gyur pa bsal ba ni thabs las byung ba ste /
translated: The elimination of a real relation is the result that arises from the means.

original: rab tu byed pa dang dgos pa 'di gnyis ni thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid du 'brel to ;
analyzed: rab tu byed pa dang dgos pa 'di gnyis ni thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid du 'brel to ;
translated: These two, the treatise and the purpose, are related as the means and the result that arises from the means.

original: /'di ni re zhig spyi'i don to //
analyzed: /'di ni re zhig spyi'i don to //
translated: This is the general meaning.

original: yan lag gi don ni dngos por gyur pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas su yod pa dang / don dam pa dang / bcos ma ma yin pa dang / ma brtags pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: yan lag gi don ni dngos por gyur pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas su yod pa dang / don dam pa dang / bcos ma ma yin pa dang / ma brtags pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The specific meaning is as follows: “entity” means substantial existence, “ultimate” means not fabricated, up to “unimagined.”

original: 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni 'brel bas na 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni 'brel bas na 'brel pa ste /
translated: “Connection” means that which is connected,

original: sbyor ba dang ldan pa dang / reg pa dang / phrad pa dang / dngos po nye bar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang ldan pa dang / reg pa dang / phrad pa dang / dngos po nye bar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: which is indicated by “association,” “contact,” “meeting,” up to “the thing becoming proximate.”

original: bsal bar 'dod nas smras pa zhes bya ba ni so sor bsal bar 'dod pa dang / so sor spang bar 'dod nas smras pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsal bar 'dod nas smras pa zhes bya ba ni so sor bsal bar 'dod pa dang / so sor spang bar 'dod nas smras pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Desiring to remove” means desiring to remove individually, desiring to abandon individually.

original: gzhan dbang kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya bas ni tshigs su bcad pa ston to //
analyzed: gzhan dbang kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya bas ni tshigs su bcad pa ston to //
translated: “Only dependent” and so on indicates the verse.

original: gzhan dbang ni gzhan la rag las pa ste zhes bya ba gzhan las rag las pa'i tshig gis @2b gzhan dbang ston te /
analyzed: gzhan dbang ni gzhan la rag las pa ste zhes bya ba gzhan las rag las pa'i tshig gis @2b gzhan dbang ston te /
translated: “Dependent” means dependent on another, indicated by the phrase “dependent on another.”

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: gzhan dang 'brel ba dang / gzhan la rag las pa dang / gzhan la brten pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba don gcig go //
analyzed: gzhan dang 'brel ba dang / gzhan la rag las pa dang / gzhan la brten pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba don gcig go //
translated: “Dependent on another,” “relating to another,” “subordinate to another,” and “subordinate to a different thing” are synonymous.

original: de 'brel ba yin na zhes bya ba ni kha cig gzhan gyi dbang kho na 'brel pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: de 'brel ba yin na zhes bya ba ni kha cig gzhan gyi dbang kho na 'brel pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: If it is a relation, some believe that the dependent is only a relation.

original: de ni 'brel ba can grub pa'am ma grub pa zhig gi yin zhes bya ba 'di la 'brel ba yod pas 'brel ba can no //
analyzed: de ni 'brel ba can grub pa'am ma grub pa zhig gi yin zhes bya ba 'di la 'brel ba yod pas 'brel ba can no //
translated: Since there is a relation here, it is a relation.

original: grub pa ni rang gi ngo bor red pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa ni rang gi ngo bor red pa'o //
translated: The established is that which is established in its own nature.

original: ma grub pa ni rang gi ngo bor ma red pa'o //
analyzed: ma grub pa ni rang gi ngo bor ma red pa'o //
translated: The non-established is that which is not established in its own nature.

original: 'am gyi sgra ni rtog pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'am gyi sgra ni rtog pa'i don to //
translated: The word “or” has the sense of a choice.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽'brel ba can ma grub pa'i ngo bo'am /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / 'brel ba can ma grub pa'i ngo bo'am /
translated: This is what is being said.🔽The dependent is the non-established nature,

original: ma grub pa'i ngo bo'i gzhan gyi dbang yin //
analyzed: ma grub pa'i ngo bo'i gzhan gyi dbang yin //
translated: or the dependent is the nature of the non-established.

original: ma grub pa ni med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir 'brel pa dngos por yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'brel ba can ma grub ste ngo bo med pa yin na des na ma grub pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir 'brel ba dngos🔽por yod par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: ma grub pa ni med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir 'brel pa dngos por yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'brel ba can ma grub ste ngo bo med pa yin na des na ma grub pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir 'brel ba dngos por yod par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Thus, if the related thing is not established, that is, if it has no nature, then how could a related thing that exists as a thing come to exist, since it has the nature of nonexistence?🔽If the related thing is established, what is there that is dependent?

original: 'brel ba can grub na gzhan dbang ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni gang gi tshe 'brel ba can gyi rang gi ngo bo grub pa de'i tshe yang 'brel ba can re ba med pa'i phyir ci zhig rag las na gang gis 'di gzhan dbang du 'dod //
analyzed: 'brel ba can grub na gzhan dbang ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni gang gi tshe 'brel ba can gyi rang gi ngo bo grub pa de'i tshe yang 'brel ba can re ba med pa'i phyir ci zhig rag las na gang gis 'di gzhan dbang du 'dod //
translated: When the related thing is established, that is, when it has its own nature, then at that time, since the related thing has no need of anything, on account of what is it that you assert it to be dependent?🔽What?🔽This is not a question about the word what?

original: ci zhig ces bya ba ni sgra 'di 'dri ba ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig ces bya ba ni sgra 'di 'dri ba ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What, then?

original: sel bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sel bar byed pa yin te /
translated: It is an eliminator.

original: med pa nyid de gzhan dbang ci yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med pa nyid de gzhan dbang ci yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of what is there that is dependent is that there is no nonexistence at all.

original: de bas na 'brel ba med pa nyid do zhes bya bas ni de bas na 'brel ba gzhan dbang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na 'brel ba med pa nyid do zhes bya bas ni de bas na 'brel ba gzhan dbang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that there is no other dependent nature that is a connection.🔽If you think that even though it is established, there is something that is not established,

original: grub tu zin kyang cung zad ma grub pa yod do zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol 'di snyam du smra ste /
analyzed: grub tu zin kyang cung zad ma grub pa yod do zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol 'di snyam du smra ste /
translated: the opponent might say this:

original: rnam pa thams cad du grub pa ni gzhan gyi dbang du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du grub pa ni gzhan gyi dbang du mi 'dod do //
translated: We do not assert that the dependent nature is established in all respects.

original: 'o na kyang 'brel ba can grub tu zin kyang cha shas kha cig ma grub pa yod pas de dag grub par bya ba'i phyir 'brel ba can gzhan gyi dbang du 'dod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na kyang 'brel ba can grub tu zin kyang cha shas kha cig ma grub pa yod pas de dag grub par bya ba'i phyir 'brel ba can gzhan gyi dbang du 'dod ce na /
translated: However, even though the connected object is established, there are some parts that are not established. Therefore, in order to establish those, we assert that the connected object is the dependent nature.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rnam par rtog pa yang de grub par bya ba'i ched du gzhan gyi dbang kho nar yang mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i tshig gis sel bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rnam par rtog pa yang de grub par bya ba'i ched du gzhan gyi dbang kho nar yang mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i tshig gis sel bar byed do //
translated: The phrase “In that case, even that conception would not be the dependent nature in order to establish that” rejects this.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i cha shas grub par bya ba'i sgo nas kyang gzhan gyi dbang du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i cha shas grub par bya ba'i sgo nas kyang gzhan gyi dbang du mi 'thad do //
translated: The dependent nature is not tenable in terms of establishing some part that is of that kind.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de'i phyir grub pa dang ma grub pa las gyur ba'i nyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir grub pa dang ma grub pa las gyur ba'i nyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because one does not transcend the conceptual thoughts of the faults that arise from the established and non-established.

original: grub pa dang ma gru pa ni grub pa dang ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: grub pa dang ma gru pa ni grub pa dang ma grub pa ste /
translated: The established and non-established are the established and non-established.

original: grub pa'i phyogs dang ma grub pa'i phyogs @3a * //
analyzed: grub pa'i phyogs dang ma grub pa'i phyogs @3a * //
translated: The established position and the non-established position.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: grub pa dang ma grub pa las gyur pa'i ngang tshul can gang dag yin pa de dag grub pa dang ma grub pa las gyur ba'o //
analyzed: grub pa dang ma grub pa las gyur pa'i ngang tshul can gang dag yin pa de dag grub pa dang ma grub pa las gyur ba'o //
translated: Those that have the nature of arising from the established and non-established are the established and non-established.

original: nyes pa rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa ni nyes pa'i rtog pa ste /
analyzed: nyes pa rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa ni nyes pa'i rtog pa ste /
translated: The conceptual thoughts of the faults are the conceptual thoughts of the faults.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i sgras ni 'dir rnam par ston to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i sgras ni 'dir rnam par ston to //
translated: Here, the term “conceptual thought” is used to indicate.

original: grub pa dang ma grub pa las gyur pa yang yin la nyes pa yang yin zhes tshig bsdu'o //
analyzed: grub pa dang ma grub pa las gyur pa yang yin la nyes pa yang yin zhes tshig bsdu'o //
translated: The faults that arise from the established and non-established are the faults that arise from the established and non-established.

original: de dag las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: de dag las mi 'da' ste /
translated: They are not transcended.

original: de bas na grub pa dang ma grub pa las gyur pa'i nyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes de skad smras so //
analyzed: de bas na grub pa dang ma grub pa las gyur pa'i nyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes de skad smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one does not transcend the conceptual thoughts of the faults of the established and the non-established.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught:

original: grub pa'i ngo bo'i phyogs kyi nyes pa gang yin pa dang ma grub pa'i phyogs kyi ngo bo'i nyes pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad phyogs 'di la yang yod de /
analyzed: grub pa'i ngo bo'i phyogs kyi nyes pa gang yin pa dang ma grub pa'i phyogs kyi ngo bo'i nyes pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad phyogs 'di la yang yod de /
translated: All the faults of the established and the non-established positions exist in this position as well.

original: 'di ltar cha shas grub pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar cha shas grub pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: Thus, those parts that are established

original: grub pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: grub pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang du mi rung ngo //
translated: are not suitable to be dependent on others because they are established.

original: ma grub pa yang med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang dngos por gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa yang med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang dngos por gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: The non-established is also not a real dependent because it is a non-existent entity.

original: dngos po gcig la grub pa dang ma grub pa'i ngo bo gnyi ga yang med do zhes bya ba ni dngos po gcig la grub pa dang ma grub pa'i ngo bo yang med de //
analyzed: dngos po gcig la grub pa dang ma grub pa'i ngo bo gnyi ga yang med do zhes bya ba ni dngos po gcig la grub pa dang ma grub pa'i ngo bo yang med de //
translated: It is said that in one entity, neither the established nor the non-established exist.

original: 'di ltar cha shas med pa ni dngos por 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar cha shas med pa ni dngos por 'dod do //
translated: Thus, the partless is accepted as an entity.

original: cha shas dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob tu yod pa yin no //
analyzed: cha shas dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob tu yod pa yin no //
translated: That which has parts is conventional.🔽Because of that, the other-dependent that is established or not established is called “nonexistent,” as explained.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar grub pa'am cig shos kyi gzhan gyi dbang kho na med pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad du smos pa'i tshul gyis ji ltar grub pa'am ma grub pa'i gzhan gyi dbang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar grub pa'am cig shos kyi gzhan gyi dbang kho na med pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad du smos pa'i tshul gyis ji ltar grub pa'am ma grub pa'i gzhan gyi dbang mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable that the other-dependent is established or not established in the way that has been explained.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is because

original: grub pa'i phyogs la gzhan gyi dbang kho na med cing ma grub pa'i phyogs la yang gzhan gyi dbang dngos por mi 'thad do //
analyzed: grub pa'i phyogs la gzhan gyi dbang kho na med cing ma grub pa'i phyogs la yang gzhan gyi dbang dngos por mi 'thad do //
translated: the other-dependent is not established in the position of establishment and the other-dependent is not tenable as a thing in the position of nonestablishment.

original: de bas na dngos po thams cad kyi 'brel ba yang dag nyid du dngos por med de /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po thams cad kyi 'brel ba yang dag nyid du dngos por med de /
translated: Therefore, the connection of all things is not a real thing.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi 'brel ba gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid don dam par med do zhes mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi 'brel ba gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid don dam par med do zhes mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: The connection of all things, which is the characteristic of the other-dependent, does not exist ultimately. This is the summary.

original: dngos por zhes bya ba 'dis ni yang dag nyid du zhes bya ba de bshad do //
analyzed: dngos por zhes bya ba 'dis ni yang dag nyid du zhes bya ba de bshad do //
translated: The word “thing” here explains the word “real.”

original: rnam par rtog pas bkod pa ni mi dgag go zhes bya ba ni rtog pas gzhag pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gang yin pa de ni mi dgag ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas bkod pa ni mi dgag go zhes bya ba ni rtog pas gzhag pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gang yin pa de ni mi dgag ste /
translated: The dependent nature that is posited by imagination is not refuted.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir dngos po med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “because it does not exist.”

original: gang gi phyir rtog pas bskyed pa'i gzhan gyi dbang ni dngos por yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir mi dgag go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtog pas bskyed pa'i gzhan gyi dbang ni dngos por yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir mi dgag go //
translated: The dependent nature that is generated by imagination does not exist as a thing. Therefore it is not refuted.🔽If you say that the dependent nature is related to the imagination of what is unreal because it is mixed with it,🔽the response to that is: “If you say that the dependent nature is related to the imagination of what is unreal because it is mixed with it, that is not so.”

original: ngo bo 'dres pa 'brel ba yin gyi gzhan @3b gyi dbang kho na ni ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'on te 'di snyam du nga ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid 'brel ba yin par mi smra'i 'o na ci zhe na /🔽ngo bo 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo 'dres pa 'brel ba yin gyi gzhan @3b gyi dbang kho na ni ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'on te 'di snyam du nga ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid 'brel ba yin par mi smra'i 'o na ci zhe na / ngo bo 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: If you think that the dependent nature is related to the imagination of what is unreal because it is mixed with it, that is not so.

original: ngo bo gnyis kyi 'am ngo bo rnams kyi 'dres pa ni ngo bo 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: ngo bo gnyis kyi 'am ngo bo rnams kyi 'dres pa ni ngo bo 'dres pa ste /
translated: The mixing of two natures or the mixing of natures is the mixing of natures.

original: rang gi ngo bo phrad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo phrad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “the meeting of its own nature” is the mixing of natures.

original: de ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste /
translated: That is not tenable.

original: gnyis nyid do  yin zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni 'brel ba can gnyis kyi ngo bo yin na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyis nyid do  yin zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni 'brel ba can gnyis kyi ngo bo yin na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The explanation of the compound “dvayor abhāvaḥ” is “the non-existence of the two realities.”

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: 'brel ba can ni 'dir ngo bo nyid kho na yin na ngo bo 'dres pa de yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'brel ba can ni 'dir ngo bo nyid kho na yin na ngo bo 'dres pa de yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: If the two realities were mixed, then the two realities would be one reality.

original: ngo bo 'dres pa'i sgra rang gi ngo bo gcig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba des bshad de //
analyzed: ngo bo 'dres pa'i sgra rang gi ngo bo gcig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba des bshad de //
translated: The compound “abhinnaḥ svabhāvaḥ” is explained by the word “abhinnaḥ,” which means “one.”

original: rang gi ngo bo gcig pa'i mtshan nyid der yang ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo gcig pa'i mtshan nyid der yang ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: how could the two realities be mixed in the sense of having one nature?

original: 'di'i bshad pa ni mi 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i bshad pa ni mi 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The explanation of this is “there would be no difference.”

original: 'di ni 'gog pa yin te dri ba ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'gog pa yin te dri ba ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: This is a refutation, not a question.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: ji srid du 'brel ba can gnyis kyi ngo bo mi 'dor ba de srid du rang gi ngo bo gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bor 'dres par ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji srid du 'brel ba can gnyis kyi ngo bo mi 'dor ba de srid du rang gi ngo bo gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bor 'dres par ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: As long as the two realities do not abandon their own natures, how could they be mixed in the sense of having one nature?

original: 'on te yang de'i tshe 'brel ba can gnyis kyi ngo bo ma yin gyi //
analyzed: 'on te yang de'i tshe 'brel ba can gnyis kyi ngo bo ma yin gyi //
translated: But if they are not the nature of the two relata at that time,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what are they?

original: 'brel ba'i dus na ngo bo gcig par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel ba'i dus na ngo bo gcig par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If they become one nature at the time of relation,

original: de'i phyir gcig tu gyur na yang 'brel ba can gnyis med pa'i phyir 'brel pa gang zhig yin gyi zhes bya ba smos te //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig tu gyur na yang 'brel ba can gnyis med pa'i phyir 'brel pa gang zhig yin gyi zhes bya ba smos te //
translated: then, in order to show that a relation is not tenable if there is only one relatum, he says, “What relation could there be?”

original: ci ste 'brel ba can gcig tu gyur na de'i tshe 'brel pa can gnyis med pas shin tu yang 'brel pa mi grub po //
analyzed: ci ste 'brel ba can gcig tu gyur na de'i tshe 'brel pa can gnyis med pas shin tu yang 'brel pa mi grub po //
translated: If the relata become one, then, since there are not two relata, a relation is not established at all.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir na zhes bya ba ni 'o na te yang ngo bo 'dres pa'i sgra ngo bo gcig la mi zer 'di gnyis la gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir na zhes bya ba ni 'o na te yang ngo bo 'dres pa'i sgra ngo bo gcig la mi zer 'di gnyis la gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to show that, he says, “Moreover, the term ‘mixed nature’ does not refer to a single nature, because it is based on these two.”

original: 'di ltar 'brel pa ni gnyis la gnas par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'brel pa ni gnyis la gnas par 'dod do //
translated: Thus a relation is asserted to be based on two things.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: 'brel pa'i gzhi ni du ma yin na 'brel pa can ngo bo gcig tu gyur na ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'brel pa'i gzhi ni du ma yin na 'brel pa can ngo bo gcig tu gyur na ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If the basis of a relation is multiple and the relata become one nature, how could that be?

original: 'on te 'di skad du 'dres pa ni ngo bo nyid gcig tu gyur pa ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di skad du 'dres pa ni ngo bo nyid gcig tu gyur pa ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: But if you say that “mixed” does not mean that they have a single nature, but rather

original: bar med pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba 'am 'on te yang ngo bo 'dres pa'i sgra ngo bo gcig pa la mi zer gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: bar med pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba 'am 'on te yang ngo bo 'dres pa'i sgra ngo bo gcig pa la mi zer gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: that they are without interval, or if you say that the term “mixed nature” does not refer to a single nature, but rather

original: dngos po rnam par med pa kho na ngo bo 'dres pa yin no //🔽zhes smra na /
analyzed: dngos po rnam par med pa kho na ngo bo 'dres pa yin no // zhes smra na /
translated: that a mixed nature is a nature that is completely devoid of things,

original: yin du zad mod ci zhig dgag ste /
analyzed: yin du zad mod ci zhig dgag ste /
translated: then what are you refuting?

original: ci ste bar med pa la ngo bo 'dres pa'i sgrar brjod na legs par brjod shin tu brjod de de ni nga 'gog pa med do //🔽bar med pa ni bar med pa tsam du zad pas 'brel pa @4a * //
analyzed: ci ste bar med pa la ngo bo 'dres pa'i sgrar brjod na legs par brjod shin tu brjod de de ni nga 'gog pa med do // bar med pa ni bar med pa tsam du zad pas 'brel pa @4a * //
translated: If you say that “without interval” is a synonym for “mixed nature,” then we agree, and we have no argument with you.

original: dngos por gyur pa yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la bar dang bral bas bar med pa ste /
analyzed: dngos por gyur pa yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la bar dang bral bas bar med pa ste /
translated: But if “without interval” simply means “without interval,” then it cannot refer to a real relationship.

original: bar gyi sgra ni phrag la bya'o //
analyzed: bar gyi sgra ni phrag la bya'o //
translated: The term “interval” refers to a gap.

original: bar med pa'i ngo bo ni bar med pa'o //
analyzed: bar med pa'i ngo bo ni bar med pa'o //
translated: “Without interval” means “without a gap.”

original: ci ste ngo bo 'dres pa'i sgra bar med pa la brjod na de'i tshe mi 'dod pa ci zhig brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste ngo bo 'dres pa'i sgra bar med pa la brjod na de'i tshe mi 'dod pa ci zhig brjod pa yin te /
translated: But if you say that the term “without interval” refers to the mixing of the entities, then what is the point of saying that?

original: 'o na kyang 'brel ba dngos por gyur pa ni mi 'grub po //🔽gzhan yang ci ste bar chad med pa 'brel ba yin na bar dang bcas pa na yang 'brel ba ci ste mi 'dod de zhes bya ba ni ci ste bar med par gnas pa la bar med pa zhes bya ba'i 'brel ba yin par khas len na de'i
analyzed: 'o na kyang 'brel ba dngos por gyur pa ni mi 'grub po // gzhan yang ci ste bar chad med pa 'brel ba yin na bar dang bcas pa na yang 'brel ba ci ste mi 'dod de zhes bya ba ni ci ste bar med par gnas pa la bar med pa zhes bya ba'i 'brel ba yin par khas len na de'i
translated: But even so, you do not establish a connection that is a real entity.🔽Moreover, if you say that the connection is without interval, then why not accept that it is also with interval?🔽If you accept that the connection called “without interval” is that which abides without interval, then why not accept that the connection called “with interval” is that which abides separately?

original: tshe so sor gnas pa la yang bar dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i 'brel ba ci ste khas mi blang ci ste yang ji ltar na bar med pa'i 'brel pa khas len na par dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba yang yod par 'gyur ba yin zhe
analyzed: tshe so sor gnas pa la yang bar dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i 'brel ba ci ste khas mi blang ci ste yang ji ltar na bar med pa'i 'brel pa khas len na par dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba yang yod par 'gyur ba yin zhe
translated: Why is it that if you accept the connection without interval, then the connection with the characteristic of interval also exists?

original: na / de'i phyir gnyi gar yang 'brel ba can gnyis rang gi ngo bo la gnas par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: na / de'i phyir gnyi gar yang 'brel ba can gnyis rang gi ngo bo la gnas par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: because there is no difference in the intrinsic reality of the two related things whether they are in contact or not.

original: ji ltar 'brel pa can gnyis 'dres pa na sngon gyi rang bzhin mi 'dor ba bzhin du so sor gnas pa na yang sngon gyi rang bzhin ma bor ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'brel pa can gnyis 'dres pa na sngon gyi rang bzhin mi 'dor ba bzhin du so sor gnas pa na yang sngon gyi rang bzhin ma bor ba yin no //
translated: Just as the two related things do not abandon their previous intrinsic reality when they are mixed, so also they do not abandon their previous intrinsic reality when they are separate.🔽Therefore, just as you accept that the two related things are related when they are not in contact, so also you should accept that they are related when they are in contact.

original: de bas na ji ltar 'brel pa can gnyis par med pa la 'brel bar 'dod pa de bzhin du bar dang bcas pa la yang 'dod par byas shig / yang na ni gnyis kar yang 'brel ba khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar 'brel pa can gnyis par med pa la 'brel bar 'dod pa de bzhin du bar dang bcas pa la yang 'dod par byas shig / yang na ni gnyis kar yang 'brel ba khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Or else, you should not accept that they are related in either case.

original: 'o na te yang bar med pa la ni ngo bo 'dres par khas len pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na te yang bar med pa la ni ngo bo 'dres par khas len pa ma yin no //
translated: But if you do not accept that they are mixed when they are not in contact,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what do you accept?

original: phrad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phrad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: You accept that they are in contact.

original: de'i phyir phrad pa la sogs pa yang bar chad med pa'i don du 'dus pa kho na yin pas brjod par ma byed cig ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phrad pa la sogs pa yang bar chad med pa'i don du 'dus pa kho na yin pas brjod par ma byed cig ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: because contact, etc. also are only collections in the sense of being without intervals, do not mention them.

original: bar du med pa'i don du 'dus pa'i ngang tshul can gang dag yin pa de dag ni bar med pa'i don du 'dus pa kho na ste /
analyzed: bar du med pa'i don du 'dus pa'i ngang tshul can gang dag yin pa de dag ni bar med pa'i don du 'dus pa kho na ste /
translated: Those which are in the state of being conjoined in the sense of being without an interval are only conjoined in the sense of being without an interval.

original: bar med par bstan pa gang yin pa de nyid phrad par bstan pa yang de yin no //
analyzed: bar med par bstan pa gang yin pa de nyid phrad par bstan pa yang de yin no //
translated: That which is taught as being without an interval is also taught as being in contact.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni nye ba dang / rig pa dang par mchod pa la sogs pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni nye ba dang / rig pa dang par mchod pa la sogs pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: The words “etc.” should be seen as including “near,” “cognizant,” “first,” “worship,” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir bar med pa'i rnam grangs phrad pa la sogs pa yin pa de'i phyir 'dir de skad ston pa ni chen po mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bar med pa'i rnam grangs phrad pa la sogs pa yin pa de'i phyir 'dir de skad ston pa ni chen po mi rung ngo //
translated: Since the synonyms of “without an interval” are “in contact” and so on, therefore to teach it in this way here is not appropriate.🔽Since the nature of things is not mixed,

original: gang gi phyir de ltar ngo bo 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid kyang 'brel ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar ngo bo 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid kyang 'brel ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: there is no connection.

original: srid ces bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: srid ces bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The word “is” is a verbal suffix.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin tha dad pa la zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni 'og nas dngos po thams cad kyi @4b rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin tha dad pa la zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni 'og nas dngos po thams cad kyi @4b rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore the explanation “because of being different in nature” below is “because of being different in nature in all things.”

original: rang gi ngo bo sna tshogs pa'i dngos po de dag thams cad la 'brel ba yang dag nyid du med de /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo sna tshogs pa'i dngos po de dag thams cad la 'brel ba yang dag nyid du med de /
translated: All those things that are of various natures are not really related.

original: don dam par de dag rang gi ngo bo 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba med do //
analyzed: don dam par de dag rang gi ngo bo 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba med do //
translated: In the ultimate sense, they are not related by the character of a mixture of natures.

original: rtog pas sgro btags pa las ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni rtog pas brtags pa'i 'brel pa ni mi dgag go //
analyzed: rtog pas sgro btags pa las ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni rtog pas brtags pa'i 'brel pa ni mi dgag go //
translated: “ Except for what is imagined by conceptualization” means that a relation imagined by conceptualization is not refuted.

original: 'o na te gzhan ltos pa 'brel ba yin gyi ngo bo 'dres pa ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te yang nga ni ngo bo 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid la 'brel bar khas mi len gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na te gzhan ltos pa 'brel ba yin gyi ngo bo 'dres pa ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te yang nga ni ngo bo 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid la 'brel bar khas mi len gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: “ But if it is a relation of dependence, not a relation of a mixture of natures” means that if one does not accept a relation characterized by a mixture of natures, then what is it?

original: ltos pa'i mtshan nyid la 'brel bar smra'o //
analyzed: ltos pa'i mtshan nyid la 'brel bar smra'o //
translated: It is said that a relation is characterized by dependence.

original: de bas na ji skad du smos pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na ji skad du smos pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the previously mentioned error does not arise.

original: 'dir yang gzhan ltos pa na ltos pas 'brel pa can du gyur pa'i phyogs 'di la yang myu gu la sogs pa gzhan gang yin pas bon la sogs pa la ltos te /
analyzed: 'dir yang gzhan ltos pa na ltos pas 'brel pa can du gyur pa'i phyogs 'di la yang myu gu la sogs pa gzhan gang yin pas bon la sogs pa la ltos te /
translated: Here, in this system in which something else is dependent, that which is dependent becomes related.

original: myu gu la sogs pa de ltos pa na ltos pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel te /
analyzed: myu gu la sogs pa de ltos pa na ltos pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel te /
translated: If a sprout and so on is dependent on a seed and so on, then that sprout and so on is related by the character of dependence.

original: 'brel pa can du khas len na brtags pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'brel pa can du khas len na brtags pa gnyis te /
translated: If one asserts that they are related, there are two examinations.

original: ltos nas yod pa zhig ltos sam med pa zhig ltos /
analyzed: ltos nas yod pa zhig ltos sam med pa zhig ltos /
translated: If something exists in dependence, is it dependent on something existent or nonexistent?

original: yod pa ni rang gi ngo bor gyur cing yod pa'o //🔽med pa ni rang gi ngo bor ma grub cing med pa yod to //
analyzed: yod pa ni rang gi ngo bor gyur cing yod pa'o // med pa ni rang gi ngo bor ma grub cing med pa yod to //
translated: That which exists is something that has its own nature and exists.🔽That which is nonexistent is something that does not exist and is not established as having its own nature.

original: ci ste med na zhes bya ba ni re zhig ci ste med pa'i ltos par kas len na med na de ni ci ltar ltos zhes bya ba de nyid kyi bshad pa ni 'og nas rang gi ngo bor ma grub pa'i dngos po la ltos pa'i chos med
analyzed: ci ste med na zhes bya ba ni re zhig ci ste med pa'i ltos par kas len na med na de ni ci ltar ltos zhes bya ba de nyid kyi bshad pa ni 'og nas rang gi ngo bor ma grub pa'i dngos po la ltos pa'i chos med
translated: If it is nonexistent, then if one asserts that it is dependent, how could it be dependent?

original: pas zhes bya ba smras te //
analyzed: pas zhes bya ba smras te //
translated: The explanation of that is stated later:🔽“A phenomenon that is not established as having its own nature does not depend on anything else.”

original: gang zhig rang gi ngo bor ma grub cing ma thob pa de ji ltar ltos par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zhig rang gi ngo bor ma grub cing ma thob pa de ji ltar ltos par byed par 'gyur /
translated: How could that which does not exist by way of its own entity and is not obtained be related?

original: pas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de ni des na zhes bya bar rig par bya ste /🔽med pas gang zhig gang gi 'brel ba yin zhes bya ba ni de bas na ltos pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba gang yang med la /
analyzed: pas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de ni des na zhes bya bar rig par bya ste / med pas gang zhig gang gi 'brel ba yin zhes bya ba ni de bas na ltos pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba gang yang med la /
translated: The word “therefore” should be understood to mean “because of that.”🔽Since it does not exist, what is related to what?

original: gang gi yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore there is no relation whatsoever that has the characteristic of dependence, and it is not the relation of any other kind.🔽Even if it did exist, it would not depend on anything.

original: yod na yang kun la rag ma las zhes bya ba ni gang zhig rang gi ngo bo thams cad grub pa de ni rnam pa thams cad du re ba med do //
analyzed: yod na yang kun la rag ma las zhes bya ba ni gang zhig rang gi ngo bo thams cad grub pa de ni rnam pa thams cad du re ba med do //
translated: That which is established by way of its own entity does not require anything in any way.

original: de nyid kyi bshad pa ni rang gi ngo bo thams cad skyes pa ltos pa med pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi bshad pa ni rang gi ngo bo thams cad skyes pa ltos pa med pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The explanation of that is “Things that are not dependent are said to be produced by way of their own entity.”

original: thams cad kyang yin la rang gi ngo bo yang yin pas rang gi ngo bo thams cad do //
analyzed: thams cad kyang yin la rang gi ngo bo yang yin pas rang gi ngo bo thams cad do //
translated: Since it is all and it is an entity, it is all entities.

original: de dag skyes pa la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de dag skyes pa la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That which is produced is called that.

original: skyes pa'i sgra ni byung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: skyes pa'i sgra ni byung ba la bya'o //
translated: The word “produced” is used for that which has arisen.

original: rang gi ngo bo thams cad bskyed par bya ba'i phyir mi ltos te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo thams cad bskyed par bya ba'i phyir mi ltos te /
translated: It does not depend on anything else for its own nature, because

original: rang gi dngos po thams @5a * //🔽cad skyes pa ltos pa med pa'i ngo bo ltos pa gang gis ni 'brel bar 'gyur ba ji ltar ltos pa yin //
analyzed: rang gi dngos po thams @5a * // cad skyes pa ltos pa med pa'i ngo bo ltos pa gang gis ni 'brel bar 'gyur ba ji ltar ltos pa yin //
translated: all of its own nature is produced.🔽How can that which is produced without depending on anything else be related by dependence?

original: gang zhig rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs pa'i ngo bo de gang gis na 'brel par khas blang bar 'gyur ba ltos pa'i rnam pa gang gis gzhan ltos pa yin /
analyzed: gang zhig rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs pa'i ngo bo de gang gis na 'brel par khas blang bar 'gyur ba ltos pa'i rnam pa gang gis gzhan ltos pa yin /
translated: How can that which is completely perfect in every way be related by dependence, since it is not accepted that it is related?

original: lhag ma ni gzhan gyi dbang bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni gzhan gyi dbang bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be explained as in the case of the other-dependent.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di la lhag ma brjod par bya ba gang yin pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di la lhag ma brjod par bya ba gang yin pa'ang yod de /
translated: There is something else that should be explained here.

original: de ni gzhan gyi dbang dpyad pa ji skad brjod pa de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi dbang dpyad pa ji skad brjod pa de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: That should be explained as the other-dependent was explained.

original: de yang 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
translated: That should be explained as follows.

original: ci ste pha rol po na re rnam pa thams cad du yongs su grub pa ni ltos pa'i chos can du mi brjod do //
analyzed: ci ste pha rol po na re rnam pa thams cad du yongs su grub pa ni ltos pa'i chos can du mi brjod do //
translated: If the opponent says that the completely perfected is not described as having the quality of dependence,

original: grub tu zin kyang 'on kyang cung zad ma grub pa yod pas de grub par bya ba'i phyir ltos so zhes smra na de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: grub tu zin kyang 'on kyang cung zad ma grub pa yod pas de grub par bya ba'i phyir ltos so zhes smra na de yang mi rung ste /
translated: But if you say, “Although it is established, it is not established in the slightest, and so it is dependent in order to be established,” that also is not tenable.

original: grub pa dang ma grub pa las gyur ba'i nyes pa las mi 'da' ba'i phyir dang / gcig la 'ang grub pa dang ma grub pa'i ngo bo gnyis ka yang med do zhes sngar bstan pa bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: grub pa dang ma grub pa las gyur ba'i nyes pa las mi 'da' ba'i phyir dang / gcig la 'ang grub pa dang ma grub pa'i ngo bo gnyis ka yang med do zhes sngar bstan pa bzhin du bya'o //
translated: Because you do not escape the error of that which is established and that which is not established, and because, as was previously explained, neither the nature of that which is established nor that which is not established exists in a single basis.

original: 'brel pa rnam pa gsum po de ni 'brel pa can gyi rang gi ngo bo las rang gi ngo bo tha mi dad par khas len pa la dpyad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa rnam pa gsum po de ni 'brel pa can gyi rang gi ngo bo las rang gi ngo bo tha mi dad par khas len pa la dpyad pa yin te /
translated: This analysis of the three types of relation is in terms of the assertion that the relation is not different from the nature of the related.

original: 'di ltar smra ba gang dag 'brel pa can nyid kyi nang du 'dus shing 'brel ba can gyi ngo bo la 'brel pa'i sgrar brjod pa de'i chen du 'di bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar smra ba gang dag 'brel pa can nyid kyi nang du 'dus shing 'brel ba can gyi ngo bo la 'brel pa'i sgrar brjod pa de'i chen du 'di bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is because those who say this assert that the relation is included in the related and that the term “relation” is used for the nature of the related.

original: da ni smra ba gang dag 'brel pa can las ngo bo tha dad pa'i 'brel pa khas len pa de bsal ba'i phyir nyes pa 'dir mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: da ni smra ba gang dag 'brel pa can las ngo bo tha dad pa'i 'brel pa khas len pa de bsal ba'i phyir nyes pa 'dir mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Now, in order to eliminate those who assert a relation that is different in nature from the relata, he says, “In order to avoid this fault.”

original: gang yang 'brel pa rnam pa gsum po 'brel pa can gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi phyogs la nyes pa bstan pa 'dir mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang yang 'brel pa rnam pa gsum po 'brel pa can gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi phyogs la nyes pa bstan pa 'dir mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that in order to avoid the fault that is shown in the position of the nature of the relata themselves, which is the three kinds of relations.

original: gnyis zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni 'brel pa can gnyis zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gnyis zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni 'brel pa can gnyis zhes bya ba yin te /

original: pu'i don med par yang 'brel pa khas len na de'i tshe 'brel pa can dang po gnyis la yang 'brel pa gcig pu'i rgyu mtshan gyis 'brel par khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: pu'i don med par yang 'brel pa khas len na de'i tshe 'brel pa can dang po gnyis la yang 'brel pa gcig pu'i rgyu mtshan gyis 'brel par khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: If, in some cases, you accept a relation even though there is no object of a single relation, then you should not accept that the relation is based on the first two related things, because they are related to a single object.

original: 'on te yang 'brel pa can gnyis 'brel pa'i don gcig pus 'brel ba ma yin gyi 'brel pa can nye tshe zhig 'brel par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yang 'brel pa can gnyis 'brel pa'i don gcig pus 'brel ba ma yin gyi 'brel pa can nye tshe zhig 'brel par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the two relata are not related by the mere fact of having a single relation, but rather that the relatum that is a part is related,

original: de'i phyir nyi tshe zhig 'brel pa yin na yang nyes pa smras zin to zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyi tshe zhig 'brel pa yin na yang nyes pa smras zin to zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then Nāgārjuna says, “The error has already been explained even if the part is related.”

original: 'brel pa can nyi tshe'i 'brel pa yang khas blang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa can nyi tshe'i 'brel pa yang khas blang bar mi bya ste /
translated: The part is not accepted as a relatum.

original: 'di ltar de la nyes pa sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la nyes pa sngar bstan zin to //
translated: The error has already been explained in that regard.🔽The response to the conception of distinct attributes such as being without a middle has also already been given.🔽This is because the mere fact of having a single relation is refuted.

original: bar med pa la sogs pa'i chos tha dad par rtog pa'i lan kyang des btab zin to zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa gcig pu'i don gyi sgo nas 'brel pa can gnyis 'brel par smras pa gang yin pa de bsal ba nyid kyis bar med pa dang /
analyzed: bar med pa la sogs pa'i chos tha dad par rtog pa'i lan kyang des btab zin to zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa gcig pu'i don gyi sgo nas 'brel pa can gnyis 'brel par smras pa gang yin pa de bsal ba nyid kyis bar med pa dang /
translated: The refutation of the distinct attributes of being without a middle,

original: phrad pa dang nye ba la sogs pa'i chos tha dad pa nyid bsal bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: phrad pa dang nye ba la sogs pa'i chos tha dad pa nyid bsal bar rig par bya ste /
translated: meeting, being near, and so on should be understood.

original: bar med pa la sogs pa'i chos gzhan 'brel pa gcig pu'i don gyis 'brel pa can gnyis 'brel par mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bar med pa la sogs pa'i chos gzhan 'brel pa gcig pu'i don gyis 'brel pa can gnyis 'brel par mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not tenable that two related things are related by the meaning of a single relation, such as non-difference, etc.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar 'brel pa rnam par rtog pa rung ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa can gcig pu'i sgo nas kyang 'di ltar 'brel pa'i rnam par rtog pa shin tu mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar 'brel pa rnam par rtog pa rung ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa can gcig pu'i sgo nas kyang 'di ltar 'brel pa'i rnam par rtog pa shin tu mi 'thad do //
translated: Since that is so, the phrase “the conception of a relation is not tenable” means that in this way, the conception of a relation is not tenable even by means of a single related object.

original: de bas na dngos po de gnyis zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni 'brel pa can du mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po de gnyis zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni 'brel pa can du mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the explanation of the phrase “those two things” is “that which is asserted to be a related object.”

original: 'brel pa can ni 'dir dngos por bshad do //🔽de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni 'brel pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa can ni 'dir dngos por bshad do // de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni 'brel pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Here, a related object is explained as a thing.🔽The explanation of the phrase “that which is different from that” is “relation.”

original: 'brel pa ni 'dir de las gzhan pa'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni 'dir de las gzhan pa'i sgras brjod do //
translated: Here, a relation is expressed by the term “that which is different from that.”

original: de dag thams cad ces bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni ji @7b skad du smos pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad ces bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni ji @7b skad du smos pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The explanation of the phrase “all of those” is “as stated.”

original: 'brel pa dang 'brel pa can du mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa dang 'brel pa can du mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to: as related and as having a relation.

original: bdag nyid gnas zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni 'og nas rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid gnas zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni 'og nas rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The explanation of “abiding in itself” is: “it abides in its own-nature.”

original: bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo la gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo la gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: “it abides in its own nature.”

original: de bas na de'i phyir zhes bya ba la de bas kyi sgra ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na de'i phyir zhes bya ba la de bas kyi sgra ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the word “therefore” is explained by this “because.”

original: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni 'brel pa med pa'o zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni 'brel pa med pa'o zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The explanation of “unmixed” is: “without a relation.”

original: so so na 'dug ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: so so na 'dug ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: “it remains separate.”

original: rang zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni bdag nyid ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rang zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni bdag nyid ces bya ba yin te /
translated: The explanation of “itself” is: “itself.”

original: rang gi ngo bo la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: “in its own-nature.”

original: dngos zhes bya ba ni dngos po'o //
analyzed: dngos zhes bya ba ni dngos po'o //
translated: “Entity” means “existence.”

original: 'di skad bstan to /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan to /
translated: This is taught.

original: 'brel pa can gnyis dang 'brel pa ni gang gi phyir so so rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa de bas na dngos po thams cad rang gi ngo bo ma 'dres pa ma phrad pa /🔽ma 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa can gnyis dang 'brel pa ni gang gi phyir so so rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa de bas na dngos po thams cad rang gi ngo bo ma 'dres pa ma phrad pa / ma 'brel pa yin no //
translated: The relation of the two related things is that they exist in their own nature. Therefore, all things have their own nature, are unmixed, do not make contact, and are not related.

original: 'o na ji ltar rag las pa'i ngo bo de dang des 'brel pa yin par brjod ce na zhes bya ba ni ci ste dngos po thams cad 'brel pa med na ji ltar 'brel pa de dang des rag las pa'i ngo bor ston te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rag las pa'i ngo bo de dang des 'brel pa yin par brjod ce na zhes bya ba ni ci ste dngos po thams cad 'brel pa med na ji ltar 'brel pa de dang des rag las pa'i ngo bor ston te / 'di lta ste /
translated: If all things are unrelated, how can they be shown to be related by that relation?

original: rje khol gyi sgo nas rgyal po'i mi zhes bya ba dang / cha shas dang cha shas can gyi sgo nas shing gi yal ga zhes bya ba dang / rgyu 'bras kyi sgo nas sa bon gyi myu gu zhes bya ba dang rig pa 'dzin pa'i sgo nas mkhan po dang slob ma zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: rje khol gyi sgo nas rgyal po'i mi zhes bya ba dang / cha shas dang cha shas can gyi sgo nas shing gi yal ga zhes bya ba dang / rgyu 'bras kyi sgo nas sa bon gyi myu gu zhes bya ba dang rig pa 'dzin pa'i sgo nas mkhan po dang slob ma zhes bya ba dang /
translated: For example, a king’s man is shown by the relation of master and servant, a tree’s branch is shown by the relation of part and whole, a seed’s sprout is shown by the relation of cause and effect, and a teacher and student are shown by the relation of knowledge holder and holder of knowledge.

original: de la sogs pa'i 'brel pa ji ltar bstan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i 'brel pa ji ltar bstan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In this way, how can relations such as these be shown?

original: 'brel pa yang dag pa ni gang yang med kyi zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa zhes bya ba don dam par gang yang med kyi dngos po de dag 'dres pa med kyang rtogs pas 'dres par byed par zad de /
analyzed: 'brel pa yang dag pa ni gang yang med kyi zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa zhes bya ba don dam par gang yang med kyi dngos po de dag 'dres pa med kyang rtogs pas 'dres par byed par zad de /
translated: There is no connection called “real” at all. Although those things are not mixed, conceptualization merely mixes them.

original: dngos po rnams rtog pa nyid kyis 'dres par byed do //
analyzed: dngos po rnams rtog pa nyid kyis 'dres par byed do //
translated: Conceptualization mixes things.🔽And it arises as if it were a sign that depends on something else.

original: de yang gzhan la rag las pa'i ngo bo lta bur mtshan ma 'ga' zhig ston pa skye'o zhes bya ba ni rtog pa ni mtshan ma cung zad cig bzung nas dngos po rnams gzhan la rag las pa'i ngo bo lta bur ston to //
analyzed: de yang gzhan la rag las pa'i ngo bo lta bur mtshan ma 'ga' zhig ston pa skye'o zhes bya ba ni rtog pa ni mtshan ma cung zad cig bzung nas dngos po rnams gzhan la rag las pa'i ngo bo lta bur ston to //
translated: Conceptualization, having apprehended some slight sign, shows things as if they were the nature that depends on something else.

original: 'tsho ba sbyin pa dang bka' bzhin du byed pa'i sgo nas rgyal po dang 'bangs zhes rje khol 'brel par rtog go //
analyzed: 'tsho ba sbyin pa dang bka' bzhin du byed pa'i sgo nas rgyal po dang 'bangs zhes rje khol 'brel par rtog go //
translated: One conceptualizes a king and a servant as being connected, through the giving of livelihood and the doing of bidding.

original: spyi dang cha shas dbyer med pa dang / spyi gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi sgo nas shing gi yal gzhis bya ba cha shas dang / cha shas can 'brel bar rtog par byed do //🔽de la rag las @8a * //
analyzed: spyi dang cha shas dbyer med pa dang / spyi gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi sgo nas shing gi yal gzhis bya ba cha shas dang / cha shas can 'brel bar rtog par byed do // de la rag las @8a * //
translated: The relation of the whole and the parts is established by the inseparability of the whole and the parts, and by the reason for the designation of the whole.

original: de skye ba dang / de'i rigs kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i sgo nas sa bon gyi myu gu zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel par ston par byed do //
analyzed: de skye ba dang / de'i rigs kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i sgo nas sa bon gyi myu gu zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel par ston par byed do //
translated: The relation of the cause and the effect is established by the dependence of the effect on the cause, by the production of the effect from the cause, and by the seed and the sprout, etc., being of the same kind.

original: shes rab mngon par 'du byed pa dang de'i spyod pa'i rjes su byed pa'i sgo nas mkhan po dang slob ma zhes sdom brtson gyi rtsa ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: shes rab mngon par 'du byed pa dang de'i spyod pa'i rjes su byed pa'i sgo nas mkhan po dang slob ma zhes sdom brtson gyi rtsa ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa ston par byed do //
translated: The relation of the root and the branch is established by the dependence of the vow-holder on the teacher, and by the teacher’s activity and the vow-holder’s activity.

original: de bas na rtog pa nyid kyis dngos po rnams 'brel par byed kyi don dam par 'dres pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na rtog pa nyid kyis dngos po rnams 'brel par byed kyi don dam par 'dres pa med do //
translated: Therefore, things are related by mere conceptualization; in reality, there is no mixing.

original: de ltar re zhig rje khol gyi dngos po la sogs pa'i 'brel pa bkag go //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rje khol gyi dngos po la sogs pa'i 'brel pa bkag go //
translated: Thus, the relation of master and servant, etc., is refuted.

original: bya ba dang byed pa'i 'brel pa yang dgag par 'dod nas de'i zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni rtog pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa'i 'brel pa yang dgag par 'dod nas de'i zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni rtog pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The relation between action and agent is also to be refuted. The explanation of “his” in “his action” is “imagination.”

original: tshig le'ur byas pa las de'i yang zhes byung ba las yang gi sgras ni 'ang gi sgra'i don du bstan te /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa las de'i yang zhes byung ba las yang gi sgras ni 'ang gi sgra'i don du bstan te /
translated: In the Kārikā, “his” is used instead of “their.” The word “his” is used in the sense of the word “their.”

original: 'di'i 'bang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i 'bang zhes bya'o //
translated: This is what is meant by “his.”

original: rjes su 'brang ba'i skyes bu yis //
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba'i skyes bu yis //
translated: The person who follows

original: zhes bya ba ni rtog pa nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i srog chags kyis bya ba ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtog pa nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i srog chags kyis bya ba ba'i don to //
translated: means that the action is done by the living being who follows imagination.

original: bya ba dang ni byed pa'i tshig / ces bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni bya ba'i tshig dang byed pa'i tshig ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bya ba dang ni byed pa'i tshig / ces bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni bya ba'i tshig dang byed pa'i tshig ces bya ba yin te /
translated: The explanation of “the words of action and agent” is “the words of action and the words of agent.”

original: kha cig ni bya ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni bya ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: Some are words of action.

original: ji skad du 'tshing ngo //
analyzed: ji skad du 'tshing ngo //
translated: For example, “he cooks,”

original: klog go zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: klog go zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “he reads,” and so on.

original: kha cig ni byed pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni byed pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: Some are words of agent.

original: dper na lha sbyin gyis rdza mar 'bras chang 'tshing ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin gyis rdza mar 'bras chang 'tshing ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, “Devadatta cooks rice gruel in a pot,” and so on.

original: smra ba po dag 'god par byed ces bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni 'di ni bya ba brjod pa'o //
analyzed: smra ba po dag 'god par byed ces bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni 'di ni bya ba brjod pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the statement “the speakers posit” is as follows:

original: 'di ni byed pa brjod pa'o zhes tshig 'god par byed do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byed pa brjod pa'o zhes tshig 'god par byed do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “This is the expression of action,” “This is the expression of the agent.”

original: 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i sgra ni bya ba la tha snyad 'dogs so //
analyzed: 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i sgra ni bya ba la tha snyad 'dogs so //
translated: The words “cooking,” etc., are expressions for action.🔽The words “Devadatta,” etc., are expressions for the agent.

original: lha sbyin la sogs pa'i sbra ni byed pa po la tha snyad 'dogs so ci'i phyir ming 'dogs /
analyzed: lha sbyin la sogs pa'i sbra ni byed pa po la tha snyad 'dogs so ci'i phyir ming 'dogs /
translated: Why are they designated?

original: ci'i phyir tha snyad 'dogs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tha snyad 'dogs she na /
translated: Why are they conventionally expressed?

original: dngos po tha dad rtogs bya'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po tha dad rtogs bya'i phyir te /
translated: In order to understand the difference in things.

original: 'di nyid kyi bshad pa ni 'og nas dngos po tha dad pa ni gzhan bsal ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi bshad pa ni 'og nas dngos po tha dad pa ni gzhan bsal ba'o //
translated: The explanation of this is as follows: “The difference in things is the exclusion of other.”

original: de khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: In order to understand that,

original: rtogs pa'i dus na ji ltar na gzhan las bzlog pa'i rtogs par 'gyur bar bya ba dang byed pa po'i tshig gi sgra tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dus na ji ltar na gzhan las bzlog pa'i rtogs par 'gyur bar bya ba dang byed pa po'i tshig gi sgra tha snyad du byed do //
translated: at the time of understanding, the words “agent” and “action” are conventionally used in order to make one understand the exclusion of other.

original: tha snyad kyi tshe na ni tshig 'god do //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi tshe na ni tshig 'god do //
translated: At the time of convention, the words are posited.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: ji ltar na lha sbyin kho na byed pa po yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes byed pa po gzhan bsal ba'i phyir lha sbyin gyi tshig sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar na lha sbyin kho na byed pa po yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes byed pa po gzhan bsal ba'i phyir lha sbyin gyi tshig sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Just as one uses the expression “Devadatta” in order to exclude other agents, saying “Devadatta alone is the agent, not another.”

original: de bzhin du rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa'i @8b byed pa bsal ba'i phyir shing gis zhes bya ba'i sgra 'god par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa'i @8b byed pa bsal ba'i phyir shing gis zhes bya ba'i sgra 'god par byed do //
translated: Similarly, in order to exclude grass, leaves, and so on, one uses the expression “wood.”

original: zangs bu dang phru ba la sogs pa'i gzhi nyid bsal ba'i phyir rdza ma zhes sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: zangs bu dang phru ba la sogs pa'i gzhi nyid bsal ba'i phyir rdza ma zhes sbyor bar byed do //
translated: In order to exclude the basis of copper, clay, and so on, one uses the expression “pot.”

original: sngo tshod dang sran tshod la sogs pa'i las bsal ba'i phyir 'bras chan zhes sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: sngo tshod dang sran tshod la sogs pa'i las bsal ba'i phyir 'bras chan zhes sbyor bar byed do //
translated: In order to exclude the function of vegetables, lentils, and so on, one uses the expression “rice.”

original: ston mo bsham pa'i bya ba bsal ba'i phyir 'tshed pa'i sgra 'god par byed do //
analyzed: ston mo bsham pa'i bya ba bsal ba'i phyir 'tshed pa'i sgra 'god par byed do //
translated: In order to exclude the function of preparing a feast, one uses the expression “cooking.”

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same is to be applied in other cases as well.

original: bya ba dang byed pa po'i 'brel pa dngos su yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang byed pa po'i 'brel pa yang don dam par ni med do //
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa po'i 'brel pa dngos su yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang byed pa po'i 'brel pa yang don dam par ni med do //
translated: The relationship between action and agent does not exist ultimately.

original: 'di ltar bya ba dang byed pa yang gzhan gyi dbang nyid la sogs pa'o mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa grub na grub pa zhig na de yang ji skad smos pa'i tshul gyis bsal zin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ba dang byed pa yang gzhan gyi dbang nyid la sogs pa'o mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa grub na grub pa zhig na de yang ji skad smos pa'i tshul gyis bsal zin to //
translated: If the relationship of action and agent were established, then action and agent would be established. But that has already been refuted by the method stated above.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i 'brel pa'am 'grub pa dang 'grub par byed pa'i 'brel pa de yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i 'brel pa'am 'grub pa dang 'grub par byed pa'i 'brel pa de yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa nyid yin la /
translated: The relationship between the probandum and the proof, or the relationship between the established and the establisher, is the relationship of cause and effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyang 'og nas sel bar 'gyur na bya ba dang byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa gang zhig yin /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyang 'og nas sel bar 'gyur na bya ba dang byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa gang zhig yin /
translated: The characteristic of the entity of cause and effect will be refuted later, so what is the relationship characterized by action and agent?

original: 'o na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa 'grub mod ce na zhes bya ba ni ci ste pha rol po na re ji skad sngar smos pa'i 'brel pa de dag ma grub tu zin kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod mod🔽ces smra ba'o //

translated: “ It could not be” shows that this is a refutation.

analyzed: de'i phyir blos sprel te 'brel na ni rnam par rtog pas skyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: 'di ltar rim las kyang dngos po gcig la zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni rgyu 'am 'bras bu gcig la zhes bya ba yin te /

analyzed: gang gi tshe 'bras bu la gnas pa de'i rgyu la mi ltos so //

analyzed: ci ste don gcig dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: de ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de ni go sla'o //

analyzed: rgyu 'bras nyid yin par zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni 'dod na zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: de'i tshe grangs su brjod pa gnyis nyid la sogs pa 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis phyugs kyi g-yas g-yon rva yang rgyu dang 'bras bu kho na thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyugs kyi g-yas g-yon gyi rva gnyis kyang gnyis nyid ces🔽bya ba'i gcig dang 'brel pa yod do //

translated: The two horns on the right and left of an ox are connected with the one called “two.”

original: de'i phyir de gnyis kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de gnyis kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'thob par 'gyur ro //

original: de ltar na mi 'dod na zhes bya ba ni de gnyis rgyu dang 'bras bur mi 'dod na'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mi 'dod na zhes bya ba ni de gnyis rgyu dang 'bras bur mi 'dod na'o //
translated: “If you do not accept that” means if you do not accept that those two are cause and effect.
