translated: Moreover, it would be otherwise, i.e., it would not be the case that the desired result would be produced. The phrase “and so on” indicates that the other side would be this side, and the horn would be related to the horn, etc.

original: tshu rol nyid dang rva nyid ces bya ba gcig pu ni rva nyid dang ldan pa yod do //
analyzed: tshu rol nyid dang rva nyid ces bya ba gcig pu ni rva nyid dang ldan pa yod do //
translated: The phrase “the other side, this side, and the horn” is a single unit, and the horn is related to the horn.

original: de bas na de gnyis kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na de gnyis kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, those two would also obtain the status of cause and effect.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is demonstrated as follows:

original: ci ste don gcig dang ldan pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por khas len na de'i tshe rva gnyis kyang gnyis nyid ces bya ba gcig dang ldan pa yod pas de gnyis kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por khas blang bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: ci ste don gcig dang ldan pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por khas len na de'i tshe rva gnyis kyang gnyis nyid ces bya ba gcig dang ldan pa yod pas de gnyis kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por khas blang bar bya dgos so //
translated: If you accept the status of cause and effect because they possess the same object, then in that case, since the two horns also possess the same object called “twoness,” you must accept that they also have the status of cause and effect.

original: ma yin na ni mngon par 'dod pa la yang mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma yin na ni mngon par 'dod pa la yang mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not, then it is not tenable even in regard to what is accepted.

original: ci ste pha rol po na re gang yang rung ba cig dang 'brel pa'i phyir ma 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste pha rol po na re gang yang rung ba cig dang 'brel pa'i phyir ma 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But if the opponent says that it is not the case that there is no relation because there is a relation with something,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what is that relation?

original: 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid dang ngo zhe na zhes smra ba ni bdag dang gang yang rung ba cig dang ldan pa'i phyir dngos po rnams 'brel par smra ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'brel pa zhes bya ba gcig dang 'brel pa'i phyir zhes 'brel par smra'o zhe
analyzed: 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid dang ngo zhe na zhes smra ba ni bdag dang gang yang rung ba cig dang ldan pa'i phyir dngos po rnams 'brel par smra ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'brel pa zhes bya ba gcig dang 'brel pa'i phyir zhes 'brel par smra'o zhe
translated: If he says that it is the characteristic of relation, then he is not saying that things are related because they are related to something, but rather that they are related because they are related to a single relation called “relation.”🔽That is not tenable.

original: na / de ni mi rung ste zhes bya ba ni 'gog @11a * //🔽pa'i tshig go //🔽dngos bo'i don 'ga' zhig gnyis gnas pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni 'brel ba yin gyi zhes bya ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: na / de ni mi rung ste zhes bya ba ni 'gog @11a * // pa'i tshig go // dngos bo'i don 'ga' zhig gnyis gnas pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni 'brel ba yin gyi zhes bya ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is a word of refutation.🔽The explanation of this passage, “The meaning of the thing that is the basis of the two,” is the word “relation.”

original: gnyis la gnas pa'i dngos po'i don ni 'brel ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis la gnas pa'i dngos po'i don ni 'brel ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the passage is that the meaning of the thing that is the basis of the two is called “relation.”

original: de las zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni don gnyis dang mngon par 'brel pa can zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni don gnyis dang mngon par 'brel pa can zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The explanation of “from that” is “that which is connected with the two aims.”

original: don gnyis kyis mngon par 'brel pa zhes tshig sbyar ro //
analyzed: don gnyis kyis mngon par 'brel pa zhes tshig sbyar ro //
translated: The compound is to be resolved as “connected with the two aims.”

original: de 'di la yod pas ni don gnyis dang mngon par 'brel pa can no //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas ni don gnyis dang mngon par 'brel pa can no //
translated: Since it has that, it is connected with the two aims.

original: yang na don gnyis la mngon par 'brel pa'i ngang tshul can 'di gang yin pa de don gnyis dang mngon par 'brel pa can te /
analyzed: yang na don gnyis la mngon par 'brel pa'i ngang tshul can 'di gang yin pa de don gnyis dang mngon par 'brel pa can te /
translated: Or, that which has the nature of being connected with the two aims is connected with the two aims.

original: dngos po gnyis dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽gzhan du de'i zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni de'i 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad na zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gnyis dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to // gzhan du de'i zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni de'i 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad na zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The meaning is that it possesses the two things.🔽The explanation of “other than that” is “if the characteristic of its connection is not tenable.”

original: 'di'i 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di'i 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the characteristic of its connection is not tenable in any other way.

original: gang gis na grangs la sogs pa las de'i khyad par rnam par gzhag par bya zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs gang gis na grangs la sogs pa dang mi 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid khas len par byed //
analyzed: gang gis na grangs la sogs pa las de'i khyad par rnam par gzhag par bya zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs gang gis na grangs la sogs pa dang mi 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid khas len par byed //
translated: This is to say, by what reason would you accept a characteristic that is not similar to number, etc.?

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: don gnyis dang mngon par 'brel pa can ma gtogs par gzhan du 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid brjod du med pa yin na gang gis na grangs la sogs pa dang mi 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid khas blang bar bya /
analyzed: don gnyis dang mngon par 'brel pa can ma gtogs par gzhan du 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid brjod du med pa yin na gang gis na grangs la sogs pa dang mi 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid khas blang bar bya /
translated: If a characteristic that is related to something other than the two objects is inexpressible, then by what means would you accept a characteristic that is not similar to number, etc.?

original: 'dir yang pha rol bo dag smra ba 'ga' zhig yod na yod par 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni sa bon yod na myu gu yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir yang pha rol bo dag smra ba 'ga' zhig yod na yod par 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni sa bon yod na myu gu yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here, if the opponent says, “If the seed exists, the sprout exists,” this means that if the seed exists, the sprout exists.

original: med na med par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni sa bon nyid med na myu gu med pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: med na med par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni sa bon nyid med na myu gu med pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: If the seed does not exist, the sprout does not exist,” this means that if the seed itself does not exist, the sprout does not exist.

original: yod par gyur pa dang med par gyur pa de gnyis kyang zhes bya ba ni sa bon yod na myu gu yod pa yin te /
analyzed: yod par gyur pa dang med par gyur pa de gnyis kyang zhes bya ba ni sa bon yod na myu gu yod pa yin te /
translated: Since the seed exists, the sprout exists.

original: de bas na gnyis ka yang 'dod pa'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na gnyis ka yang 'dod pa'i sgras brjod do //
translated: Therefore, both are referred to by the word “existent.”

original: sa bon med na myu gu med pa yin te /
analyzed: sa bon med na myu gu med pa yin te /
translated: Since the seed does not exist, the sprout does not exist.

original: de bas na gnyis ka yang med pa'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na gnyis ka yang med pa'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: Therefore, both are referred to by the word “non-existent.”

original: yod pa dang med pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni sa bon dang myu gu'i 'brel pa can yod pa dang med pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni sa bon dang myu gu'i 'brel pa can yod pa dang med pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “The existent and the non-existent” means the existent and non-existent that are related to the seed and sprout.

original: de'i bye brag can khyad par gyi sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni 'brel ba zhes bya ste zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa gnyis kyi dmigs kyis phye ba gang yin pa 'di ni 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i bye brag can khyad par gyi sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni 'brel ba zhes bya ste zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa gnyis kyi dmigs kyis phye ba gang yin pa 'di ni 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “The connection is the application of a distinction to that” means that the distinction between the existent and non-existent is called “connection.”

original: yod pa dang med pa'i bye brag can gyi sbyor ba @11b 'di ci ste rgyu 'bras kho na yin te zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pas dmigs kyis phye ba'i 'brel pa ni rgyu 'bras kho nar 'dod kyi thams cad ni ma yin no zhe na
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i bye brag can gyi sbyor ba @11b 'di ci ste rgyu 'bras kho na yin te zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pas dmigs kyis phye ba'i 'brel pa ni rgyu 'bras kho nar 'dod kyi thams cad ni ma yin no zhe na
translated: Why is this application that is specified by existence and nonexistence only cause and effect?

original: zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'o //
translated: This is the opponent’s position.

original: 'dir grub pa'i mtha' smra ba dag gis ci ste yod pa dang med ba dag gis bye brag can gyi sbyor ba rgyu 'bras kho na yin na de'i tshe sbyor ba'i bye brag can gang yin pa'i yod pa dang med pa de nyid 'dir ni rgyu 'bras ci'i
analyzed: 'dir grub pa'i mtha' smra ba dag gis ci ste yod pa dang med ba dag gis bye brag can gyi sbyor ba rgyu 'bras kho na yin na de'i tshe sbyor ba'i bye brag can gang yin pa'i yod pa dang med pa de nyid 'dir ni rgyu 'bras ci'i
translated: Here, the proponents of tenets say, “If this application that is specified by existence and nonexistence is only cause and effect, then at that time, what is the cause and effect of the existence and nonexistence that is the specification of the application here?”

original: phyir min zhes bya ba ni ci ste yid pa dang / med pa gnyis kyis bye brag tu byas pa'i sbyor ba ni rgyu 'bras su khas len na de'i tshe yod pa dang med pa de gnyis nyid rgyu 'bras kho na yin par ci ste khas mi len na gang gis yod pa ma yin zhing don med pa'i 'brel
analyzed: phyir min zhes bya ba ni ci ste yid pa dang / med pa gnyis kyis bye brag tu byas pa'i sbyor ba ni rgyu 'bras su khas len na de'i tshe yod pa dang med pa de gnyis nyid rgyu 'bras kho na yin par ci ste khas mi len na gang gis yod pa ma yin zhing don med pa'i 'brel
translated: “Not the other” means “not non-existent.” If you accept that the two, existence and non-existence, are causes and effects, then why do you not accept that the two, existence and non-existence, are causes and effects?🔽What is the point of imagining a connection that does not exist and is meaningless?

original: pa rtog par byed ces bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa gnyis rgyu 'bras nyid yin na nyes pa ci yod na gang gis na khyed yod pa ma yin zhing dgos pa med pa'i 'brel pa rtog par byed //
analyzed: pa rtog par byed ces bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa gnyis rgyu 'bras nyid yin na nyes pa ci yod na gang gis na khyed yod pa ma yin zhing dgos pa med pa'i 'brel pa rtog par byed //
translated: If the two, existence and non-existence, are causes and effects, what is the problem? Why do you imagine a connection that does not exist and is meaningless?

original: tha dad ces bya ba 'di gnyis rnam par dbye ba ni 'di snyam du yod na yod pa yin la /
analyzed: tha dad ces bya ba 'di gnyis rnam par dbye ba ni 'di snyam du yod na yod pa yin la /
translated: The two, “different” and “not different,” are distinguished in the following way. If they are different, then existence is existence.

original: med na med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni brjod par bya ba mang po yin te zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'brel pa can gyi yod pa dang med pa gnyis dang / 'bras bu dang 'brel pa can gyi yang gnyis so //
analyzed: med na med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni brjod par bya ba mang po yin te zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'brel pa can gyi yod pa dang med pa gnyis dang / 'bras bu dang 'brel pa can gyi yang gnyis so //
translated: The two existences and non-existences related to the cause, and the two related to the effect.🔽The word only, which expresses the same meaning, is not appropriate as the object of expression.

original: don gcig rjod par byed pa rgyu dang 'bras bu kho nar zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod pa'i yul du de mi rigs pas zhes bya ba la rgyu dang 'bras bu ni rgyu 'bras so //
analyzed: don gcig rjod par byed pa rgyu dang 'bras bu kho nar zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod pa'i yul du de mi rigs pas zhes bya ba la rgyu dang 'bras bu ni rgyu 'bras so //
translated: Cause and effect are cause and effect.

original: de'i dngos po ni rgyu dang 'bras bu kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni rgyu dang 'bras bu kho na ste /
translated: That state is only cause and effect.

original: 'di ni dngos po'i rkyen gyis bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po'i rkyen gyis bsdu ba'o //
translated: This is the inclusion by the condition of entity.

original: dngos po'i rkyen gyis ni de la 'brel pa yod par brjod do //
analyzed: dngos po'i rkyen gyis ni de la 'brel pa yod par brjod do //
translated: By the condition of entity, the existence of that connection is expressed.

original: de bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu kho na'i sgras 'brel pa brjod la de yang gcig yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu kho na'i sgras 'brel pa brjod la de yang gcig yin no //
translated: Therefore, only cause and effect is expressed by the word connection, and that is one.

original: de bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu kho na'i don gcig rjod par byed pa rgyu dang 'bras bu kho na zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod pa'i yul du don mang po de mi rigs pas yod pa dang med pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu kho nar mi 'dod do zhe
analyzed: de bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu kho na'i don gcig rjod par byed pa rgyu dang 'bras bu kho na zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod pa'i yul du don mang po de mi rigs pas yod pa dang med pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu kho nar mi 'dod do zhe
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that the word “only” refers to many objects, since it expresses only the meaning of cause and effect.

original: na zhes bya ba ni de bas na yod pa dang med pa rgyu dang 'bras bu kho nar mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'o //
analyzed: na zhes bya ba ni de bas na yod pa dang med pa rgyu dang 'bras bu kho nar mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'o //
translated: Therefore, we do not assert that only existence and nonexistence are cause and effect.🔽This is the opponent’s position.

original: 'dir grub pa'i mtha' smra bas sgra 'di ni smra bar byed pa'i skyes bu la brten pa ma yin nam zhes smras te /
analyzed: 'dir grub pa'i mtha' smra bas sgra 'di ni smra bar byed pa'i skyes bu la brten pa ma yin nam zhes smras te /
translated: Here the Proponents of the Tenets of the Buddhist schools say, “Is this word not dependent on a person who speaks?”

original: sgra thams cad smra bar byed pa la brten pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sgra thams cad smra bar byed pa la brten pa ma yin nam /
translated: Are not all words dependent on a speaker?

original: smra bar byed pa yang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du sbyor gyi dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin no //🔽de ltar na smra bar byed pa la @12a * //

original: pha rol po dag kyang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa las rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan ma yin na yang ji ltar yod pa dang med pa gnyis kyis bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: pha rol po dag kyang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa las rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan ma yin na yang ji ltar yod pa dang med pa gnyis kyis bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The opponent says: “If the effect is not different from the cause, then how can existence and nonexistence establish it?”

original: ji ste rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ni yod pa dang med pa las logs shig na yod pa ma yin na ji ltar de gnyis kyis de bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: ji ste rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ni yod pa dang med pa las logs shig na yod pa ma yin na ji ltar de gnyis kyis de bsgrub par bya /
translated: If the relation of cause and effect does not exist apart from existence and nonexistence, then how can those two establish it?

original: tha dad pa med pa la ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po gang yang ma mthong ngo zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa la ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po gang yang ma mthong ngo zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: We think that if they are not different, then there is no such thing as that which is to be established and that which establishes it.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de yod na yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de yod na yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The proponent of the thesis says, “Because the reason exists when it exists.”

original: de yod pa ni de yod na zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de yod pa ni de yod na zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: “When it exists” means “if it exists.”

original: rgyu yod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu yod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is “if the cause exists.”

original: de yod na yod pa ni de yod pa'o //
analyzed: de yod na yod pa ni de yod pa'o //
translated: “It exists when it exists” means “it exists if it exists.”

original: de bas na de yod na yod pa'i rtags las de 'bras rtogs zhes bya ba la de'i 'bras bu ni de 'bras so //
analyzed: de bas na de yod na yod pa'i rtags las de 'bras rtogs zhes bya ba la de'i 'bras bu ni de 'bras so //
translated: Therefore, the statement “The effect is known from the reason of existence when it exists” means that the effect of that is the effect of that.

original: de'i 'bras bu rtogs pa ni de 'bras rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu rtogs pa ni de 'bras rtogs pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the effect of that is the knowledge of the effect of that.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gang yod na yod pa de ni 'bras bur rtogs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gang yod na yod pa de ni 'bras bur rtogs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, “That which exists when it exists is known as the effect.”

original: gang yod na dngos po gang yod pa'i dngos po de ni 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang yod na dngos po gang yod pa'i dngos po de ni 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: That which exists when a thing exists is called the effect of that thing.

original: gang yang rjes su smra ba ni zhes bya ba 'di nyid ni 'og nas rgyu 'di'i 'bras bu 'di'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ston te /
analyzed: gang yang rjes su smra ba ni zhes bya ba 'di nyid ni 'og nas rgyu 'di'i 'bras bu 'di'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ston te /
translated: The statement “The one who speaks of the effect” is taught below by the phrase “The effect of this cause is that.”

original: rgyu 'di'i 'bras bu 'di'o zhes gang nges shing de smra bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu 'di'i 'bras bu 'di'o zhes gang nges shing de smra bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The one who speaks of the effect of this cause is that which is ascertained as the effect of this cause.

original: brda'i yul du de brjod de zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni de yod na yod pa nyid kyis gang yang de skad du smra ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad kyi yul du de bstan gyi zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: brda'i yul du de brjod de zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni de yod na yod pa nyid kyis gang yang de skad du smra ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad kyi yul du de bstan gyi zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The explanation of the phrase “that is the object of the convention” is this: “If it exists, it exists, and that is taught to be the object of the convention ‘cause and effect.’ ”

original: rgyu yod na 'bras bu yod par 'gyur ba ni de yod na yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu yod na 'bras bu yod par 'gyur ba ni de yod na yod pa nyid do //
translated: If the cause exists, the effect will exist. That is the meaning of “if it exists, it exists.”

original: de ltar gang yod na yod pa nyid kyis 'bras bu yin par brjod pa de rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis kyi tha snyad kyi yul du bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar gang yod na yod pa nyid kyis 'bras bu yin par brjod pa de rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis kyi tha snyad kyi yul du bstan to //
translated: Thus, that which is called an effect because it exists if that exists is taught to be the object of the convention of cause and effect.

original: don tha dad pa ni med do zhes bya ba ni 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu yang gzhan la /
analyzed: don tha dad pa ni med do zhes bya ba ni 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu yang gzhan la /
translated: “There is no difference in meaning” means that the cause and effect are not different.

original: de yod na yod pa nyid kyang gzhan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yod na yod pa nyid kyang gzhan pa ma yin no //
translated: “If it exists, it exists” is not different from that.

original: ci 'dra zhe na zhes bya ba ni dpe 'dri ba'o //🔽lkog shal sogs las glang rtogs bzhin //
analyzed: ci 'dra zhe na zhes bya ba ni dpe 'dri ba'o // lkog shal sogs las glang rtogs bzhin //
translated: What is it like? This asks for an example.🔽Like an elephant is cognized from its tusk, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar lkog shal la sogs pa glang khong du chud pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar lkog shal la sogs pa glang khong du chud pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as an elephant is cognized from its tusk, etc.,

original: @14a * // de nyid ston pa ni 'di ni ba lang yin te /🔽lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis pa lang gi tha snyad kyi yul du ston to zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa de ba lang yin no zhes bya ba des ji ltar lkog
analyzed: @14a * // de nyid ston pa ni 'di ni ba lang yin te / lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis pa lang gi tha snyad kyi yul du ston to zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa de ba lang yin no zhes bya ba des ji ltar lkog
translated: The explanation of that is as follows: This is a cow🔽because it possesses a dewlap and so on.🔽This demonstrates that the object of the convention “cow” is that which possesses a dewlap and so on.🔽Since it is said that that which possesses a dewlap and so on is a cow, it demonstrates that the object of the convention “cow” is that which possesses a dewlap and so on.

original: shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid ba lang gi tha snyad kyi yul du bstan pa de bzhin du de yod na yod pa'i don gang yin pa de 'bras bu'i zhes 'bras bu'i tha snyad kyi yul du bstan to //
analyzed: shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid ba lang gi tha snyad kyi yul du bstan pa de bzhin du de yod na yod pa'i don gang yin pa de 'bras bu'i zhes 'bras bu'i tha snyad kyi yul du bstan to //
translated: In the same way, that which exists when it exists is demonstrated to be the object of the convention “effect.”

original: gzhan yang pha rol po dag smra ba ji ste yod pa dang med pa gnyis rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin na rgyu nyid 'ba' zhig gam 'bras bu 'ba' zhig kyang gnyi gar gtogs te yod pa dang med pa la ltos par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: gzhan yang pha rol po dag smra ba ji ste yod pa dang med pa gnyis rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin na rgyu nyid 'ba' zhig gam 'bras bu 'ba' zhig kyang gnyi gar gtogs te yod pa dang med pa la ltos par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni
translated: Moreover, if both existence and nonexistence are the cause and effect, then either the cause alone or the effect alone would belong to both, for they would rely on existence and nonexistence.

original: ji ste yod pa dang med pa rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du khas len na de'i tshe rgyu nyid 'ba' zhig kyang gnyis kar gtogs shing yod pa dang med pa ltos la de bzhin du 'bras bu nyid 'ba' zhig kyang gnyi gar gtogs shing yod pa dang med🔽pa la ltos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste yod pa dang med pa rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du khas len na de'i tshe rgyu nyid 'ba' zhig kyang gnyis kar gtogs shing yod pa dang med pa ltos la de bzhin du 'bras bu nyid 'ba' zhig kyang gnyi gar gtogs shing yod pa dang med pa la ltos par 'gyur ro //
translated: And likewise, only the effect would belong to both, and existence and nonexistence would be dependent.🔽Otherwise, how could mere existence be the cause or the effect?

original: gzhan du na yod pa tsam rgyu 'am 'bras bu ji ltar yin zhes bya ba ni ji ste yang rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis so sor gnyi gar gtogs shing yod pa dang med pa la ltos par khas mi len na de'i tshe yod pa tsam 'bras bu yin
analyzed: gzhan du na yod pa tsam rgyu 'am 'bras bu ji ltar yin zhes bya ba ni ji ste yang rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis so sor gnyi gar gtogs shing yod pa dang med pa la ltos par khas mi len na de'i tshe yod pa tsam 'bras bu yin
translated: If you do not accept that the two, cause and effect, belong to both individually and are dependent on existence and nonexistence, then at that time you would accept that mere existence is the effect,

original: pa dang yod pa tsam rgyu yin par khas blang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa dang yod pa tsam rgyu yin par khas blang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and mere existence is the cause.🔽Even if that were so, what is the fault?

original: de lta yin du zad mod nyes ba ci yod na de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de lta yin du zad mod nyes ba ci yod na de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: yod pa dang med pa yin pa yang rgyu 'am 'bras bu ni yod pa dang med pa gnyis kar yang gtogs pa ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa yin pa yang rgyu 'am 'bras bu ni yod pa dang med pa gnyis kar yang gtogs pa ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And it is not the case that the existent and the nonexistent are both included in the cause or the effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur gtogs pa'i yod pa dang med pa ni rgyu nyid 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin la 'bras bu nyid 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur gtogs pa'i yod pa dang med pa ni rgyu nyid 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin la 'bras bu nyid 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin no //
translated: The existent and the nonexistent that are included in the cause and effect are not only the cause itself and not only the effect itself.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu kho na yin na ni rung ngo zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu kho na yin na ni rung ngo zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If they were only cause and effect, it would be correct.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu kho na yin na yod pa dang med pa gnyi gar gtogs par rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu kho na yin na yod pa dang med pa gnyi gar gtogs par rung ngo //
translated: If they were only cause and effect, it would be correct that both the existent and the nonexistent are included.

original: 'dir grub pa'i mtha' smra ba dag gis de mi rung ste zhes bya ba de ni 'gog pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'dir grub pa'i mtha' smra ba dag gis de mi rung ste zhes bya ba de ni 'gog pa'i tshig go //
translated: Here, the proponents of tenets say, “That is not correct.” That is a word of refutation.

original: gnyi gar gtogs su zin kyang phyi ma yod pa dang med pa'i bye grag gis rgyu snga ma yod pa dang med pa yin la /
analyzed: gnyi gar gtogs su zin kyang phyi ma yod pa dang med pa'i bye grag gis rgyu snga ma yod pa dang med pa yin la /
translated: Even if they were both included, the later existent and nonexistent are the cause, and the earlier existent and nonexistent are the effect.

original: snga ma yod pa dang med pa'i bye grag gis 'bras bu phyi ma yod pa dang med pa yin te zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa gnyis gar gtogs mod kyi 'o na @14b kyang myu gu yod pa dang med pa gnyis dmigs kyis phye ba
analyzed: snga ma yod pa dang med pa'i bye grag gis 'bras bu phyi ma yod pa dang med pa yin te zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa gnyis gar gtogs mod kyi 'o na @14b kyang myu gu yod pa dang med pa gnyis dmigs kyis phye ba
translated: Although both existence and nonexistence are included in both the cause and the effect, the existence and nonexistence of the sprout are distinguished by the existence and nonexistence of the seed.

original: ni sa bon yod pa dang med pa yin te /🔽rgyu nyid yin no //🔽sa bon yod pa dang med bas dmigs kyis phye ba ni myu gu yod pa dang med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ni sa bon yod pa dang med pa yin te / rgyu nyid yin no // sa bon yod pa dang med bas dmigs kyis phye ba ni myu gu yod pa dang med pa nyid yin te /
translated: The existence and nonexistence of the seed are the cause.🔽The existence and nonexistence of the sprout are distinguished by the existence and nonexistence of the seed.

original: 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The existence and nonexistence of the sprout are the effect.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽phyi ma yod pa dang med pa la ltos nas snga ma yod pa dang med par gyur pa ni rgyu nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / phyi ma yod pa dang med pa la ltos nas snga ma yod pa dang med par gyur pa ni rgyu nyid yin no //
translated: This is what is being taught.🔽The former existence and nonexistence that are dependent on the latter existence and nonexistence are the cause.🔽The latter existence and nonexistence that are dependent on the former existence and nonexistence are the effect.

original: snga ma yod pa dang med pa la ltos pa ni phyi ma 'bras bu nyid yin gyi rgyu 'ba' zhig gam 'bras bu 'ba' zhig ni gnyis kar gtogs pa'i yod pa dang med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: snga ma yod pa dang med pa la ltos pa ni phyi ma 'bras bu nyid yin gyi rgyu 'ba' zhig gam 'bras bu 'ba' zhig ni gnyis kar gtogs pa'i yod pa dang med pa ma yin te /
translated: Neither the cause alone nor the effect alone are both the existence and nonexistence that are included in both.

original: 'di ltar yod 'gyur yod ces bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni yod par 'gyur pa'i chos can yod na de yod pa ni zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yod 'gyur yod ces bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni yod par 'gyur pa'i chos can yod na de yod pa ni zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The explanation of this passage “If it exists, it exists” is: “If the existent property exists, then that exists.”

original: de ma thag tu yod par 'gyur ba ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de ma thag tu yod par 'gyur ba ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The effect is that which exists immediately after.

original: de yod pa ni zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni rgyur mngon par 'dod pa yod pa'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de yod pa ni zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni rgyur mngon par 'dod pa yod pa'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The explanation of this passage “If that exists” is: “If that which is asserted to be the cause exists.”🔽Here, “it exists” should be definitely ascertained.

original: de ni yod pa nyid do zhes 'dir yang nges par gzung bar bya'o zhes phyis bshad pa nyi tshe nges par gzung bar bya ba la bsten pa ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ni yod pa nyid do zhes 'dir yang nges par gzung bar bya'o zhes phyis bshad pa nyi tshe nges par gzung bar bya ba la bsten pa ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Later, it is explained that “it should be definitely ascertained” is not based on “only,” but rather

original: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa 'dir yod pa nyid do zhes nges par gzung bar blta'o //
analyzed: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa 'dir yod pa nyid do zhes nges par gzung bar blta'o //
translated: “it exists” should be definitely ascertained here, in regard to that which is asserted to be the cause.

original: de bas na tshig gi don 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na tshig gi don 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the passage is as follows.

original: de ma thag tu skye ba'i chos can gyi 'bras bu la gdon mi za bar rgyu yod de /
analyzed: de ma thag tu skye ba'i chos can gyi 'bras bu la gdon mi za bar rgyu yod de /
translated: The effect, the property that arises immediately after, definitely has a cause.

original: 'di ltar rgyu'i rgyu nyid ni 'bras bu de ma thag tu 'byung ba la gdon mi za bar nye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu'i rgyu nyid ni 'bras bu de ma thag tu 'byung ba la gdon mi za bar nye ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the cause of the cause is certainly proximate to the effect that arises immediately.

original: 'dis ni bzlog pa yang don gyis 'dren to zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung bas bzlog pa don gyis 'dren par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni bzlog pa yang don gyis 'dren to zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung bas bzlog pa don gyis 'dren par rig par bya'o //
translated: This also implies the opposite by the meaning, i.e., the opposite should be understood by the meaning.

original: de'i phyir don 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning:

original: yod pa nyid yin gyi med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa nyid yin gyi med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: it is existent, not nonexistent.

original: des na 'di skad bstan te rgyur mngon par 'dod pa gdon mi za bar nye ba yin gyi mi nye ba gang yin pa de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di skad bstan te rgyur mngon par 'dod pa gdon mi za bar nye ba yin gyi mi nye ba gang yin pa de ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, this is taught: that which is certainly proximate to what is asserted as the cause is not that which is not proximate.🔽When there is the existence of what is asserted as the cause, there is the existence of what is asserted as the effect.🔽This is the effect that is asserted as the effect.

original: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa yod pa nyid na yod par 'gyur ba ni 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu de nyid 'di ltar rgyu gang yin pa nye ba nyid yod na yod pa'o
analyzed: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa yod pa nyid na yod par 'gyur ba ni 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu de nyid 'di ltar rgyu gang yin pa nye ba nyid yod na yod pa'o
translated: The effect that is asserted as the effect exists when the cause that is asserted as the cause is proximate.

original: // rab tu grub ces bya ba ni grags zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: // rab tu grub ces bya ba ni grags zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is well established means it is well known.

original: gang gis grub ce na /🔽mngon sum mi dmigs pa dag las zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang gis grub ce na / mngon sum mi dmigs pa dag las zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: What establishes that?🔽It is said: “from perception and non-perception.”

original: mngon sum gyis dang mi dmigs pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis dang mi dmigs pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: from perception and non-perception.

original: gang rub ce na /
analyzed: gang rub ce na /
translated: What is it that is established?

original: rgyu 'bras zhes bya ba smras te /🔽rgyu dang 'bras bu ni @15a * //
analyzed: rgyu 'bras zhes bya ba smras te / rgyu dang 'bras bu ni @15a * //
translated: It is said: “cause and effect.”

original: rgyu 'bras te /
analyzed: rgyu 'bras te /
translated: Cause and effect are cause and effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i don de lta yis kyi dngos po ni rgyu dang 'bras bu kho na'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i don de lta yis kyi dngos po ni rgyu dang 'bras bu kho na'o //
translated: The meaning of cause and effect is just that.

original: de la rgyu yod na 'bras bu yod pa ni mngon sum gyis shes so //
analyzed: de la rgyu yod na 'bras bu yod pa ni mngon sum gyis shes so //
translated: Therein, the existence of an effect when there is a cause is known by perception.

original: rgyu med na 'bras bu med pa ni mi dmigs pas shes so //
analyzed: rgyu med na 'bras bu med pa ni mi dmigs pas shes so //
translated: The non-existence of an effect when there is no cause is known by non-perception.

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa gnyis kyi yod pa dang med pa rtogs pa de la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad 'jug par byed pa de bas na yod pa dang med pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu yin pa kho nar gnas te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa gnyis kyi yod pa dang med pa rtogs pa de la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad 'jug par byed pa de bas na yod pa dang med pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu yin pa kho nar gnas te /
translated: Since the existence and non-existence of cause and effect are understood by both perception and non-perception, the convention of cause and effect is applied to that. Therefore, existence and non-existence are established as just cause and effect.

original: de ltar na yod pa dang med pa nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni rtogs par zad do //
analyzed: de ltar na yod pa dang med pa nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni rtogs par zad do //
translated: Thus, existence and non-existence are the cause and effect, and not anything else. This is the understanding.

original: de bas na re zhig de tsam yang dag don zhes bya ba la de bas na zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyis so //
analyzed: de bas na re zhig de tsam yang dag don zhes bya ba la de bas na zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyis so //
translated: Therefore, that much is the correct meaning. Therefore means by the reason.

original: lhag ma ni rang nyid ston te /
analyzed: lhag ma ni rang nyid ston te /
translated: The rest is taught by itself.

original: re zhig de tsam nyid ces bya ba de'i bshad pa ni yod pa dang med pa'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de tsam nyid ces bya ba de'i bshad pa ni yod pa dang med pa'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: That much is the explanation of that much is existence and non-existence.

original: de dag nyid yang dag pa bden pa ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid yang dag pa bden pa ste /
translated: Those are the correct truths.

original: 'di gang gi don yin pa de dag nyid yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di gang gi don yin pa de dag nyid yang dag pa'o //
translated: That is the meaning of those.

original: don de ni gang dag rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: don de ni gang dag rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: That meaning is of those who conceptualize.

original: re zhig de tsam yang dag don //
analyzed: re zhig de tsam yang dag don //
translated: That much is the correct meaning.

original: zhes bya ba yan lag gi don rnams ni go sla'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yan lag gi don rnams ni go sla'o //
translated: The meanings of the parts are easy to understand.

original: spyi don bshad pa ni /
analyzed: spyi don bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the general meaning is:

original: re zhig de tsam sa bon no //🔽zhes bya ba yin te /

translated: Since the one who maintains contact is refuted, the one who maintains contact should be understood to be refuted.

original: 'di ltar sbyor ba can yang rang gi ngo bo grub pa'i phyir skye ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyor ba can yang rang gi ngo bo grub pa'i phyir skye ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po ma yin la /
translated: Thus, the one who maintains contact does not have the nature of arising and that which gives rise to it, because he already exists by his own intrinsic reality.

original: gzhi dang gnas pa'i dngos po yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhi dang gnas pa'i dngos po yang ma yin no //
translated: He also does not have the nature of a basis and that which is based on it.

original: phan par byed pa med pa yang sbyor ba can mi 'thad de /
analyzed: phan par byed pa med pa yang sbyor ba can mi 'thad de /
translated: Also, it is not tenable that the two that are not beneficial are connected.

original: shin tu thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes thams cad sbyor bar bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes thams cad sbyor bar bya'o //
translated: Because of the absurdity of that, all should be connected.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni 'dir skyon gzhan lhag par ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni 'dir skyon gzhan lhag par ston pa'o //
translated: Moreover, here another fault is shown.

original: sbyor ba ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba ni skyed bar bya ba'o //🔽de bas na de skyed pas na ci ste de gnyis sbyor ba can yin na zhes bya ba ni ci ste yang gang gi phyir 'brel pa can gnyis ni sbyor ba skyed par byed pa de bas na sbyor ba can du 'dod do //🔽de'i tshe de ltar sbyor ba skyed kyang zhes bya ba ni ci ste sbyor ba skyed du zin kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba ni skyed bar bya ba'o // de bas na de skyed pas na ci ste de gnyis sbyor ba can yin na zhes bya ba ni ci ste yang gang gi phyir 'brel pa can gnyis ni sbyor ba skyed par byed pa de bas na sbyor ba can du 'dod do // de'i tshe de ltar sbyor ba skyed kyang zhes bya ba ni ci ste sbyor ba skyed du zin kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because connection is the effect, connection is what is to be generated.🔽Therefore, if it is generated by that, why are those two connected? If the two relata generate the connection, then because of that, they are asserted to be connected.

original: 'o na kyang des de gnyis mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'o na kyang des de gnyis mi 'dod do //
translated: At that time, even though it is generated in that way, if connection is generated, then why do they not assert that?

original: des zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni sbyor ba skyed pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir zhes bya ba de yin no //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni sbyor ba skyed pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir zhes bya ba de yin no //
translated: The explanation of “that” is “because of producing the application.”

original: de gnyis zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni sbyor ba can zhes bya ba de yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni sbyor ba can zhes bya ba de yin no //
translated: The explanation of “those two” is “the one who applies.”

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: ci ste 'brel pa can dag gi sbyor ba skyed par khas blangs mod kyi 'on kyang sbyor ba skyed pa'i phyir de gnyis sbyor ba can du 'dod bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste 'brel pa can dag gi sbyor ba skyed par khas blangs mod kyi 'on kyang sbyor ba skyed pa'i phyir de gnyis sbyor ba can du 'dod bar mi bya'o //
translated: Although it is accepted that the one who applies produces the application, still, because of producing the application, those two are not accepted as the one who applies.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa tsam gyis 'dod pa'i don 'grub par ma mthong bas gtan tshigs 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa tsam gyis 'dod pa'i don 'grub par ma mthong bas gtan tshigs 'dri ba'o //
translated: Why? Since the mere assertion is not seen to accomplish the intended meaning, the reason is asked.

original: las la sogs pa sbyor ba can du 'grub ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba 'di'i tshig 'og mas @19a * //
analyzed: las la sogs pa sbyor ba can du 'grub ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba 'di'i tshig 'og mas @19a * //
translated: The following words explain this: “because of establishing the one who applies as the action, etc.”

original: bshad de / ci ste sbyor ba skyed pa'i phyir sbyor ba can yin par khas len na zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bshad de / ci ste sbyor ba skyed pa'i phyir sbyor ba can yin par khas len na zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder of the sentence is “If one accepts that the one who applies is because of producing the application.”

original: de'i tshe las kyang sbyor ba can du 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni las kyang sbyor ba can du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe las kyang sbyor ba can du 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni las kyang sbyor ba can du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, the action would also be preparatory, because the action would also be preparatory.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: 'ga' zhig gi las kyis skyes pa dang gnyis ka'i las kyi skyes pas ni sbyor ba 'dod ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi las kyis skyes pa dang gnyis ka'i las kyi skyes pas ni sbyor ba 'dod ces bya ba smos te /
translated: For example, some actions are preparatory, and some actions are both preparatory and actual.

original: sdong po dang bya khra gnyis ni 'ga'i las las skye'o //
analyzed: sdong po dang bya khra gnyis ni 'ga'i las las skye'o //
translated: The trunk and the hawk are born from the actions of some.

original: lug 'thab pa gnyis ni gnyis ga'i las las skyed pa ste /
analyzed: lug 'thab pa gnyis ni gnyis ga'i las las skyed pa ste /
translated: The two fighting rams are born from the actions of both.

original: sbyor bar khas len pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor bar khas len pa'o //
translated: This is accepted as preparatory.

original: sogs pas ni sbyor ba yang sbyor ba can du 'gyur bar bsdu ste zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba yang sbyor ba can 'thob bo zhes bya ba de'i tshig gis sdud do //
analyzed: sogs pas ni sbyor ba yang sbyor ba can du 'gyur bar bsdu ste zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba yang sbyor ba can 'thob bo zhes bya ba de'i tshig gis sdud do //
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes that the preparatory action would also be preparatory.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar de ni sbyor ba las skyes par yang 'dod ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar de ni sbyor ba las skyes par yang 'dod ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Why is that?🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: gang gi phyir sbyor ba ni sbyor ba las skyes par yang khas len to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sbyor ba ni sbyor ba las skyes par yang khas len to //
translated: Because it is also accepted that the preparatory action is born from the preparatory action.

original: sbyor ba skyed pa'i phyir sbyor ba can ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: sbyor ba skyed pa'i phyir sbyor ba can ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: It is not a preparer because it generates the arising.🔽If you say that it is a preparer because it establishes the preparation, then the opponent does not say that it is a preparer because it generates speech.

original: 'jog par byed do zhe na yang zhes bya ba ni 'on te pha rol po dag smra ba skyed pa'i phyir de sbyor ba can du smra ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang sbyor ba 'jog pa'i phyir sbyor ba can du khas len to //
analyzed: 'jog par byed do zhe na yang zhes bya ba ni 'on te pha rol po dag smra ba skyed pa'i phyir de sbyor ba can du smra ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang sbyor ba 'jog pa'i phyir sbyor ba can du khas len to //
translated: But if you accept that it is a preparer because it establishes the preparation,

original: 'dir grub pa'i mtha' smra ba rnams kyis de ni mi rung ste zhes bya ba smras pa de ni 'gog pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: 'dir grub pa'i mtha' smra ba rnams kyis de ni mi rung ste zhes bya ba smras pa de ni 'gog pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: then the proponents of tenets here say, “That is unacceptable.” That is a statement of refutation.

original: gnas par byed pa'ang rab tu 'jig //
analyzed: gnas par byed pa'ang rab tu 'jig //
translated: And it is also not a maintainer because it is destroyed.

original: ces bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni gzhag pa dang 'jog par byed pa gnyis ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir gnas pa gzhan med do zhes tshad ma rnam 'grel las spros zin to zhes bya ba ni gnas par byed pa ni
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni gzhag pa dang 'jog par byed pa gnyis ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir gnas pa gzhan med do zhes tshad ma rnam 'grel las spros zin to zhes bya ba ni gnas par byed pa ni
translated: The explanation of this is that since the two, establishment and that which establishes, are that which is generated and that which generates, there is no other enduring. This has already been elaborated in the Pramanavarttika.

original: gnas par bya ba skyed pa nyid las 'jog par byed ces bya'i de las ma gtogs par gnas pa 'ga' yang byed pa med do //
analyzed: gnas par bya ba skyed pa nyid las 'jog par byed ces bya'i de las ma gtogs par gnas pa 'ga' yang byed pa med do //
translated: It is said that the enduring causes the generation of the enduring, but apart from that, there is no enduring that causes anything.

original: 'di ltar gzhag par bya ba'i dngos po las gnas pa tha dad pa'am tha dad pa ma yin pa zhig yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhag par bya ba'i dngos po las gnas pa tha dad pa'am tha dad pa ma yin pa zhig yin //
translated: Thus, the enduring would be different from the enduring thing or not different.

original: re zhig tha dad pa ni ma yin te //
analyzed: re zhig tha dad pa ni ma yin te //
translated: First, it is not different,

original: 'di ltar gzhag par bya ba'i gnas pa'o zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhag par bya ba'i gnas pa'o zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa mi 'thad do //
translated: because it is not tenable to say that the enduring is the enduring of the enduring thing.🔽If it is not different, then the endurer would be the enduring thing itself.

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa zhig byed na yang 'jog par byed pa gzhag par bya ba nyid du byas par 'gyur ro zhes de dag tshad ma rnam 'grel las rgya cher spros so //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa zhig byed na yang 'jog par byed pa gzhag par bya ba nyid du byas par 'gyur ro zhes de dag tshad ma rnam 'grel las rgya cher spros so //
translated: This is extensively explained in the Pramanavarttika.

original: pha rol po dag la @19b yang smra ba /
analyzed: pha rol po dag la @19b yang smra ba /
translated: The opponent says:

original: ci ste sbyor ba la sogs pa med par sbyor ba la sogs pa'i blo yod na ni zhes bya ba ni ci ste sbyor ba la sogs pa med par sbyor ba la sogs pa'i blo yod par khas len na de'i tshe bral pa'i ngo bo gang yin ba
analyzed: ci ste sbyor ba la sogs pa med par sbyor ba la sogs pa'i blo yod na ni zhes bya ba ni ci ste sbyor ba la sogs pa med par sbyor ba la sogs pa'i blo yod par khas len na de'i tshe bral pa'i ngo bo gang yin ba
translated: If you say that the mind that engages and so on exists without engagement and so on, then the mind that is disengaged would also exist without disengagement.🔽If you say that the mind that engages and so on exists without engagement and so on, then the mind that is disengaged would also exist without disengagement.

original: de ldan pa'i ngo bo yang yin par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'brel pa can gnyis so sor gnas pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid ldan pa'i gnas skabs kyang yin par 'gyur ro de bas na bral ba'i gnas skabs su yang ldan pa'i blo ni ci ste
analyzed: de ldan pa'i ngo bo yang yin par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'brel pa can gnyis so sor gnas pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid ldan pa'i gnas skabs kyang yin par 'gyur ro de bas na bral ba'i gnas skabs su yang ldan pa'i blo ni ci ste
translated: If you accept that, then the entity that is disengaged

original: 'byung bar mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'byung bar mi 'gyur //
translated: would also be the entity that is engaged.🔽The entity that is the disengaged state and the entity that is the engaged state would be the same.

original: de bzhin du ldan pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid bral ba'i ngo bo yang yin zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'i gnas skabs su yang bral ba'i blo ci ste 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du ldan pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid bral ba'i ngo bo yang yin zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'i gnas skabs su yang bral ba'i blo ci ste 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, why would the mind that is engaged not also arise in the state of disengagement?🔽Similarly, why would the mind that is disengaged not also arise in the state of engagement?

original: mi gnas pa gang yin pa gnas pa yang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni gzhi la mi gnas pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid gnas pa yang yin pa dang / des na mi gnas pa'i gnas skabs su yang gnas pa'i blo ci ste 'byung bar mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mi gnas pa gang yin pa gnas pa yang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni gzhi la mi gnas pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid gnas pa yang yin pa dang / des na mi gnas pa'i gnas skabs su yang gnas pa'i blo ci ste 'byung bar mi 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, why would the cognition of endurance not arise in the state of nonendurance?

original: de ltar yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni bral ba la yang ldan pa'i blo med la /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni bral ba la yang ldan pa'i blo med la /
translated: Since that is not so, the cognition of possession does not exist in the absence of possession.

original: ldan pa la yang bral ba'i blo med /
analyzed: ldan pa la yang bral ba'i blo med /
translated: The cognition of absence of possession does not exist in the presence of possession.

original: mi gnas pa la yang mi gnas pa'i blo med /
analyzed: mi gnas pa la yang mi gnas pa'i blo med /
translated: The cognition of nonendurance does not exist in nonendurance.

original: mi 'gro ba la yang 'gro ba'i blo med ba de bas na sbyor ba dang / bral ba'i las ni sbyor ba la sogs pa blo'i rgyu mtshan nyin no zhe na zhes bya ba de ni go sla'o //
analyzed: mi 'gro ba la yang 'gro ba'i blo med ba de bas na sbyor ba dang / bral ba'i las ni sbyor ba la sogs pa blo'i rgyu mtshan nyin no zhe na zhes bya ba de ni go sla'o //
translated: The cognition of going does not exist in nongoing. Therefore the sign of the cognition of connection and disconnection is the connection and so on.

original: pha rol po'i bsam ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: pha rol po'i bsam ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: The thought of the opponent is as follows.

original: ci ste blo de dag gi rgyu mtshan rdzas yin na de'i tshe rdzas ni dus thams cad du ngo bo gcig pa yin na ci'i phyir dus thams cad du sbyor ba la sogs pa'i blo mi 'byung /🔽'dir grub pa'i mtha' smra ba dag gis de mi rung ste /
analyzed: ci ste blo de dag gi rgyu mtshan rdzas yin na de'i tshe rdzas ni dus thams cad du ngo bo gcig pa yin na ci'i phyir dus thams cad du sbyor ba la sogs pa'i blo mi 'byung / 'dir grub pa'i mtha' smra ba dag gis de mi rung ste /
translated: But if the reason for those cognitions is substance, then since substance is a single entity at all times, why does the cognition of connection and so on not occur at all times?

original: dri ba mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bshad de //🔽de bstan par khyed kyi 'ang ngo bo 'dri ba yin na bral ba la sogs pa las sbyor ba la sogs pa yang ci ste mi 'du zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa can gnyis rnam pa ji lta bu'i tshul gyis ldan pa'i ngo bo yin pa de bzhin
analyzed: dri ba mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bshad de // de bstan par khyed kyi 'ang ngo bo 'dri ba yin na bral ba la sogs pa las sbyor ba la sogs pa yang ci ste mi 'du zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa can gnyis rnam pa ji lta bu'i tshul gyis ldan pa'i ngo bo yin pa de bzhin
translated: Here the proponents of tenets explain that this is illogical because the question is similar.🔽If you ask about the entity of that, then why not also ask about connection and so on from separation and so forth?🔽If the two related objects are the entity of possession in some way, then just as the aspect of connection is like that,

original: du bral pa'i rnam pa yang de nyid yin na bral ba'i gnas skabs der khyod kyis sbyor ba 'du ba yod do zhes ci'i phyir khas mi blang /
analyzed: du bral pa'i rnam pa yang de nyid yin na bral ba'i gnas skabs der khyod kyis sbyor ba 'du ba yod do zhes ci'i phyir khas mi blang /
translated: why do you not accept that the entity of connection exists at the time of separation?

original: de bzhin du ldan pa'i gnas skabs la bral bar gyur pa yod do zhes ci'i phyir mi 'dod //
analyzed: de bzhin du ldan pa'i gnas skabs la bral bar gyur pa yod do zhes ci'i phyir mi 'dod //
translated: Likewise, why not accept that there is disjunction in the present when it is conjoined?

original: de bzhin du gnas pa la sogs pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas pa la sogs pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: So too, one should state the same for enduring and so on.

original: de skyed par byed pa'i las med pa'i phyir @20a * //
analyzed: de skyed par byed pa'i las med pa'i phyir @20a * //
translated: Because there is no action that generates it.

original: sbyor ba ni bral ba ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni bral ba ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you say, “Conjunction is not disjunction,”

original: ci ste pha rol bo dag bral ba'i gnas skabs na sbyor ba skyed par byed pa'i las med do //
analyzed: ci ste pha rol bo dag bral ba'i gnas skabs na sbyor ba skyed par byed pa'i las med do //
translated: then the opponent says, “At the time of disjunction, there is no action that generates conjunction.

original: de bzhin du ldan pa'i gnas skabs na bral ba skyed par byed pa'i las med do /
analyzed: de bzhin du ldan pa'i gnas skabs na bral ba skyed par byed pa'i las med do /
translated: Likewise, at the time of conjunction, there is no action that generates disjunction.

original: de bas na gnas skabs de gnyis na sbyor ba dang bral ba med do //
analyzed: de bas na gnas skabs de gnyis na sbyor ba dang bral ba med do //
translated: Therefore conjunction and disjunction do not exist in those two states.”

original: 'dir grub pa'i mtha' smra ba rnams kyis de lta na las kyang ci ste med ces smos pa ni 'brel pa can ngo bo 'dra ba yin na de lta na las kyang ci'i phyir yod par mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dir grub pa'i mtha' smra ba rnams kyis de lta na las kyang ci ste med ces smos pa ni 'brel pa can ngo bo 'dra ba yin na de lta na las kyang ci'i phyir yod par mi 'gyur //
translated: Here the proponents of tenets say, “If it is similar in nature to that which is related, why would action not also exist?”

original: 'o na de las byed pa med pa'i phyir las med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de las byed pa med pa'i phyir las med do zhe na /
translated: If you say, “There is no action because there is no agent,”

original: de'i phyir de byed pa yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de byed pa yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Its activity also.”

original: ji ste khyad par med pa'i ngo bo'i dngos po yin na las byed pa yang ci'i phyir yod par mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ste khyad par med pa'i ngo bo'i dngos po yin na las byed pa yang ci'i phyir yod par mi 'gyur //
translated: If it is an entity whose nature is not differentiated, why wouldn’t its activity also exist?

original: 'on te las byed pa la rgyu med do zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'on te las byed pa la rgyu med do zhes zer na /
translated: But if you say that activity is without cause,

original: de yang ji ste med ces 'dir yang de nyid kyis lan glan no //
analyzed: de yang ji ste med ces 'dir yang de nyid kyis lan glan no //
translated: then why wouldn’t it also be the case that “it does not exist”? Here, the same response is given.

original: de bas na lan de nyid yin pa'i phyir lan gdab dka'o //
analyzed: de bas na lan de nyid yin pa'i phyir lan gdab dka'o //
translated: Therefore, because this is the same response, it is difficult to respond.

original: de bas na khyed nyid kyis kyang sngar bral ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor mi rung ba phyis sbyor ba la sogs pa'i gnas rung bar dngos por de 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gyur kyang mi phan te /
analyzed: de bas na khyed nyid kyis kyang sngar bral ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor mi rung ba phyis sbyor ba la sogs pa'i gnas rung bar dngos por de 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gyur kyang mi phan te /
translated: Therefore, you yourself also said, “It is not tenable that the nature of separation and so on is a thing, but later it becomes tenable as the basis of connection and so on.” But this is of no benefit, no matter how it is construed.

original: sngar sbyor ba la sogs pa'i gzhir rung ba'i rdzas kyi ngo bo de de'i 'og tu phyis kyang de'i gnas su rung bar 'gyur ro zhes khyed nyid kyis de skad brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: sngar sbyor ba la sogs pa'i gzhir rung ba'i rdzas kyi ngo bo de de'i 'og tu phyis kyang de'i gnas su rung bar 'gyur ro zhes khyed nyid kyis de skad brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: You yourself must say that the nature of the substance that is tenable as the basis of connection and so on earlier is also tenable as its basis later.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du gtan tshigs 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du gtan tshigs 'dri ba'o //
translated: This is asking for the reason, as before.🔽If the thing that is suitable to be endowed with conjunction, etc. is permanent,

original: ji ltar sbyor ba la sogs pa dang ldan par rung ba'i dngos po rtag na ni zhes bya ba ni ci ste yang 'brel pa can ni dus thams cad du sbyor ba la sogs pa gzhir rung ba'i ngo bor 'dug ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar sbyor ba la sogs pa dang ldan par rung ba'i dngos po rtag na ni zhes bya ba ni ci ste yang 'brel pa can ni dus thams cad du sbyor ba la sogs pa gzhir rung ba'i ngo bor 'dug ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: then it is always suitable as the basis of conjunction, etc. This is the meaning.

original: de dang bral ba 'gal phyed te //
analyzed: de dang bral ba 'gal phyed te //
translated: Being devoid of that is contradictory.

original: zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni sbyor ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni 'brel pa 'gal lo zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni sbyor ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni 'brel pa 'gal lo zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The explanation of this is that being endowed with conjunction, etc. is contradictory to being related.

original: de ni rtogs par slo'i //
analyzed: de ni rtogs par slo'i //
translated: This is easy to understand.🔽Also, being devoid of conjunction, etc. should be stated in that way.

original: ded kyis kyang sbyor ba la sogs pa dang bral ba yin no zhes de skad brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba la sogs pa dang bral bar de thams cad ded kyis kyang brjod par bya ste /
